column2:
[ On days when I feel close to my partner and other friends.  á
When I feel at peace with myself and also experience a close á
contact with people whom I regard greatly.]

Every time I imagine that someone I love or I could contact a á
serious illness, even death.

When I had been obviously unjustly treated and had no possibility á
of elucidating this.

When I think about the short time that we live and relate it to á
the periods of my life when I think that I did not use this á
short time.

At a gathering I found myself involuntarily sitting next to two á
people who expressed opinions that I considered very low and á
discriminating.

When I realized that I was directing the feelings of discontent á
with myself at my partner and this way was trying to put the blame á
on him instead of sorting out my own feeliings.

I feel guilty when when I realize that I consider material things á
more important than caring for my relatives.  I feel very á
self-centered.

After my girlfriend had taken her exam we went to her parent's á
place.
When, for the first time I realized the meaning of death.

When a car is overtaking another and I am forced to drive off the á
road.

When I recently thought about the hard work it takes to study, and  á
how one wants to try something else.  When I read a theoretical á
book in English that I did not understand.
When I found a bristle in the liver paste tube.

When I was tired and unmotivated, I shouted at my girlfriend and á
and brought up negative sides of her character which are actually á
not so important.

When I think that I do not study enough.  After the weekend I á
think that I should have been able to have accomplished á
something during that time.
When I pass an examination which I did not think I did well.

When one has arranged to meet someone and that person arrives á
late, in the meantime one starts thinking about all that could á
have gone wrong e.g a traffic accident.
When one is unjustly accused of something one has not done.
When one's studies seem hopelessly difficult and uninteresting.

When one finds out that someone you know is not at all like one á
had thought, for instance friends who steal and things like that, á
quite unwarranted.
When one has been unjust, stupid towards someone else.
When one has neglected or been unjust to a good friend.
Passing an exam I did not expect to pass.

When I climbed up a tree to pick apples.  The angle of the ladder á
I was on did not enable me to get high enough.  This implied á
that the ladder was not very stable.
Friends who torture animals.
[ Same as in anger.]
Friends who torture animals.
[ Same as above - friends who torture animals.]
[ When excuses are necessary and I get out of doing it myself.]
When I had my children.

When my 2 year old son climbed up and sat on the 7th floor á
balcony with his legs hanging out.  He was holding on tightly to á
the upper railing of the balcony but he could have easily lost á
his balance when he sat down.
When my partner was attacked and lost three teeth.

When I see children on T.V from areas devastated by drought and á
war.
When I nearly walked on a blindworm and then saw it crawl away.

When I saw my 18 year old son grab an oxygen mask as he had á
breathing difficulties.  I had a bad conscience because I had not á
stopped smoking.  Medication for the dilation of his breathing á
tubes also caused a sense of guilt in me.

I experience a sense of guilt as my middle son cannot express á
himself like other children, neither verbally nor in writing.
When my child was born.

It was winter/spring and the ice was melting.  I was far out on a á
jetty and I poked the ice with a long branch to try and break it. á
 The branch went through the ice and I fell in, the water closed á
in over my head.

Unjust accusations directed at me and my way of acting, by á
someone close to me.
Failing an examination.

A drunkard fell, started bleeding and wet himself.  Disgust that á
turned into sadness-unpleasantness.
When, as an adult I have been caught lying or behaving badly.

When I am in an environment or with a person much worse off than á
me, I realize how privileged I am.
When I saw a person I had not seen for a long time.
When, as a child, I was nearly knocked down by a car.

When I heard on the radio that the football match in Belgium had á
ended in a catastrophe, and several people had died.  I could not á
 understand how normal people could behave in such a way.

When I feel lonely, perhaps because I have to study a lot and I á
am shut up in my appartment.  Nothing happens in particular á
because there is no time for anything else.

When one learns through the mass media all the wars and killing á
going on in the world.
I lied, to be precise I cancelled a meeting with a good friend.
When one lets friends down
When I was accepted for a course on finance and accounting.

A bus drove over my right leg.  The event itself was not very á
frightening but when I had to wait in the emergency ward for á
three hours and then my leg began to swell, I was frightened.

At my Summer job, nobody looked after me in particular and I had á
to learn all on my own.
When I was not accepted as a student in finance and accounting.

When I had just moved into my new appartment I found a ventilator á
in the kitchen.  I was going to clean it when I found that the á
drum was full of mud and slime.  I felt disgusted.

My elder brother and I have not always had a good relationship á
and I feel ashamed of myself as I do not call him to talk to him á
nowadays.

At my Summer job a new caretaker had been employed who was my age á
 but I preferred going out for lunch with the accounts personnel á
rather than with him.
Passed an exam by 2 points.

In a cottage in a large forest, I was alone for a while in the á
dark.
When I spoke to Jan-Erik Wikstr÷m on the telephone.
Railway station good-bye.

I saw a cripple in rags with small children in Italy.  He was á
probably an imposter.

I told a friend that I was going to a party and he would not á
enjoy himself if he came along.  He understood  that he would not á
have fitted in and there was something in that.

I was the reason behind the break-up of my friend's relationship á
with his girlfriend.  She finished with him.
I passed an exam that I was absolutely certain that I had failed.

On the way back from Denmark with a friend on a small yatch, á
there was a storm and my friend was blown overboard;  I was very á
scared till I managed to get him back onboard.
I locked myself out.
I missed the last tram home and had to walk in the pouring rain.
I found some worms in the food and I had obviously eaten some.

My friend was so intoxicated that the police came and took him á
away, and they later contacted his parents.
I hapened to overhear something which I was not meant to hear.
When I won a trip to Greece in a competition.

When I am out in the dark and a suspicious looking character á
comes towards me.

At work, when an elderly man complained unjustifiably about me and á
distrusted me.
When I had not understood anything after a lecture.
When an alcoholic stood dribbling over a food counter.

When my friend and I were discussing the good looks of a guy we á
realized that he had been listening.

When I complained about a colleague to the manager and he told á
her that someone had complained; this colleague came to me á
believing that I liked her.

At a friend's birthday party with some of my closest friends.  It á
was all very pleasant and one could say that I was happy to have á
such good friends.

On the way home one Friday night in the heavy rain the car á
acquaplanned.  I lost contact with the road surface for a few á
seconds.
Mad at my dad.
A case of unrequited love.
A bad smelling cucumber.
Nearly caught masturbating.
I do not help out enough at home.
I felt very happy when I won the football pools.

When I flew from Athens to Copenhagen after a holiday.  The plane á
was caught in a storm and it began to shake and I thouhght that á
we were going to crash.
When someone stole my bike.

When I saw the list of books to read for an acccouting course, I á
thought " Oh God how will I ever manaage it!"

It was when I read a newspaper article on the future and they á
foresaw that we would be eating frog-burgers by the year 2000.  á
An illustration showed a frog between two pieces of bread.

When I dropped a bottle in the state liquor store and everyboby á
started laughing.

When I was young - 14, I pinched from a store and was caught.  á
The store then contacted my parents.

When the whole family gets together for a one week holiday.  á
Everybody feels free and the trip is well planned.  It works out á
well and we enjoy ourselves.

When I could not find my 2 year old daughter.  I ran and looked á
for her everywhere and could not find her.  (I finally found her, á
she had gone to bed to sleep)
When friends try to put me down or hurt me.
Marriage crises.  Boredom.
When someone makes advances that one does not want.
The discovery that one has only thought of oneself.
When I spanked a child in anger and later regretted it terribly.
When I passed the first examination that I had to repeat.

When I drove to Stockholm for the first time and drove off the á
Stora Hissingen road at the wrong exit.
When my boyfriend went away for a month long holiday without me.

Last year when I worked during the Summer holidays and studied á
at the same time for an examination I had to repeat; my boyfriend á
went to Greece for a holiday for a month.
When a dog is left whining outside a shop.

When I promised to help a friend over a weekend and did not keep á
the promise.
When I realized that I had three more examinations to take.

The day I was told that I had been accepted as a student of á
economics.

While taking a short cut through the Vasa park, I was surrounded á
by three people who tried to steal my money.  I was scared and á
was saved only by the appearance of other people.

At a restaurant I observed how the gypsies tried to get money by á
cheating the foreigners i.e non Swedish speaking.  My anger had á
nothing to do with hatred against foreigners, but it was an á
expression of the anger I feel when I see people being used .

At the begining of a new course one is afraid of encountering á
problems one can not manage.  Thoughts revolve around failing á
the subject and the consequences it would have for the future.

While walking in town I noticed how the police harrassed a man á
who was under the influence of alcohol.  They terrified him with á
the thought of arrest by driving close behind him on a pedestrian á
street.  My disgust was directed at the gestures and the facial á
expressions of the policemen; they seemed to be enjoying á
themselves.

When my boyfriend revealed that he knew that I had discovered á
things of an important nature about him, I felt ashamed as I had á
not mentioned it earlier.

When I am dishonest to a friend to whom I am very close.  I á
feel guilty because I know that he gives a different version of á
the truth and I have not corrected these mistakes, and he is á
aware that I know that they are wrong.

When I found out that I had passed the last two exams by a á
margin of three marks.
When my father was ill and was waiting for the results of his tests.

When I got caught in the pouring rain last Thursday and did not á
have a raincoat on me.
When I failed an exam.

At a Sm÷rgasbord table, a man mixed differnet kinds of picked á
herrings with fruit salad.

When I had not prepared my contribution to the group as á
thoroughly as the other members, with the result that the á
overall result was poor.

When my father and I worked on the house just after he had á
recovered from illness, I was rather lazy.  This meant that he á
had to work hard and was not very well later.

When I gave birth to my son and saw that he was alive and that I á
had managed it well.  He was born a month too early with a á
malfunctioning lung.  This happened a year ago.

When I found out that my father had lung cancer and they did not á
know how long he would live.

When a colleague asked me for help at work, despite the fact á
that he had more time to do it than I had.

When I did not get the salary increase that I had been expecting á
and understood how little one's work was appreciated.
When I was weeding the garden I found a lizard in my hand.

When I met a friend whom I had not seen for a long time and á
heard all about her troubles, I thought that I should have got á
in touch with her earlier.

I got angry at my mother for something trivial.  We were in a á
bad mood because my father was very ill and I knew that my mother á
really needed support.  I had reacted wrongly.

New year's eve 1983/1984, I met my girlfriend.  We stood on the á
steps outside her parents home and I kissed her for the á
first time.

When I was stopped by plain clothes policemen because the car I á
was driving had overturned on the Avenue.  I had been driving too á
fast, and I was afraid when I was stopped, questionned and then á
toild to go.  The situation ended happily since there were no á
consequences.

The editor changed the heading of an article that I had written.  á
He considered the heading to be derogatory towards the person I had written á
about.

A close acquaintance of the family died of lung cancer.  á
Although it was expected, I still felt depressed.

When I saw a picture, in the Gothenburg Post, of a totally á
demolished car with two fatally injured passengers.  The car was á
so badly damaged that they couldn't get the bodies out at the á
scene of the accident.

One night I had a sexual intercourse with another man.  My sexual á
desire and my curiosity had made me jump into bed with him.  I am á
ashamed of myself now.

Due to laziness, I failed the term studies completely at á
University.  I also wanted, to some extent, to protest against my á
parents' expectations.
When I got the loan for my studies.

I met intoxicated people with dubious intentions in a back alley á
one Wednesday night.

On the T.V I saw a news feature on South Africa.  A policeman      á
attacked a group of black people with a whip.

The thought of having to read a boring book of 400 pages in á
English.
Grovelling people.
My inability to assert myself positively in a group.
I experience feelings of guilt because I do not study enough.

Observing someone in the cafeteria noisily gulping in his food, á
having extremely bad manners.

I guess I have often been ashamed after having talked badly of á
other people.
Having been angry and unpleasant towards my parents.

When my sister - after a history of one abortion and one á
stillbirth - gave birth to a perfectly healty boy.

When my sister had the still born child, she was emotionally very á
deep down, and it took her a long time to recover.

We were starting a student project, and the teacher we talked to á
was very negative and not very helpful.
When my boyfriend openly let me down, preferring another girl.

I felt some disgust for my boyfriend for a time, after he had á
left me.
Can't think of any.

Before an accident, my aunt offered me the front seat of the car, á
next to the driver. I declined, she took that seat and was killed á
there when the car crashed.

Unexpected visit by a close friend, whom I hadn't seen for half a á
year.

I wandered by mistake into the safety zone of a shooting range, á
and was shot at.
Being treated unfairly.
Breaking up with a girl.
Nothing.
None.
Little contact with my father before he died.

When I was accepted as a student at the college, not having á
thought it possible.

When I was the first to arrive at the scene after an accident, á
and found that a close school friend had been killed.

I was accused of having done something, which I hadn't and got á
very angry.
When my grandmother died.
Not applicable.

A couple of years ago during the summer holiday, I was fishing at á
a lake with my husband.  Suddenly it started raining while the á
sun was still shining. I experienced a feeling of joy, happiness á
and fulfillment.  the whole nature was full of music.

I was alone at home, in bed reading a womens' magazine in which á
there were storiees of paranormal experiences.  My leg was á
itching and I stretched my hand to scratch and I felt another á
strange hand. (later I realized that it was the corner of the á
blanket)

I went to a lecture and once again it had been cancelled, this á
was the second time.  One had a negative attitude towards the á
lecturer.á

I heard that a former superior of mine had died, I was later at á
home home reading about it in the newspaper and I thought of our á
interaction and how it was no longer possible.  The limited scope á
of human life is sad.

In the tram there was a fat, sickly looking woman in front of me á
who was asking for directions in a thick voice.  When she got up to á
go a disgusting smell of urine came from her.  I felt that I á
would choke.

When we were at home, my husband and I, he made a remark about á
something I had done, in a perfectly friendly manner.  My deed á
had been unjust and I knew that my husband was right, therefore my á
sense of shame.

I made a remark to my sister concerning her attitude to men, the á
way she talked and I compared her to an acquaintance of mine.  á
Later, the same evening, my sister looked sad.  I felt guilty á
about her sadness.

I had a summer job in Sweden, and my boyfriend came to meet me on á
my birthday.

I went to practice in Sweden during summer, and I was afraid that á
I would not do well.

In the holiday cottage of our association, two of my pals came to á
wake me up early one morning by bringing a radio played at the á
highest volume into my room - it was the morning service at its á
loudest.
My grandmother died suddenly last summer.

My superior at the summer job swindled customers as much as he á
could, and once put me in a difficult situation after which I á
could not but detest him.

Once I arrived two hours late to my work place (a bank) and I was á
still feeling feeble and tired.

Our association had Polish visitors and when they were going back á
by boat I did not go to see them off (I am the chairman of the á
association).

I was told quite unexpectedly that one wanted me to become the á
vice-chairman of our student organisation.  I was really á
surprised and joy was the first emotion I felt, though behind it á
there was worry - how shall I succeed ?

Our tutorial group was soon to be divided, and we got a list of á
names of freshmen, out of which five were to be in my group.  We á
read the names and then each group went its own way to a seminar á
room.  I wondered how I would cope with the new situation and if á
I would succeed as a group leader.

We were in a disco and the evening was not at all pleasant.  á
Despite my not knowing why, I was angry with my companion.  I let á
him feel my bad humour as I cannot hide my feelings.

My grandmother died, and my mother called me one sunday morning á
in the Autumn.  The way my mother told me about it, I hated her á
at that moment.  She sounded as if she had been waiting for the á
death of my grandmother.  I had lost a person close to me.  I á
felt guilty too as I had been bad to my grandmother of late.  I had not á
remained calm when she no longer understood everything so well.

At the underground station, a drunkard came to speak to me.  He á
tried to ask me something but I did not answer so he began to á
speak about me with his companion.  I detested this dirty á
growling man.

I was worried by a task related to my studies which had to be á
done in groups of two.  I was talking about it to my friends when á
I said something negative, in too abrupt a manner, concerning my á
work partner.  I did not quite mean what I said and I felt á
ashamed at having been mean enough to criticize him as he is also á
a friend of mine.

I had told my boyfriend that I did not want to go on with our á
relationship.  I knew that I was important to him but I wanted to á
be free.  I saw that this was difficult for him but I remained á
firm and did not change my mind.

Last night I had a chat with a fellow student.  I had known her á
for about half a year, and for the first time we were speaking á
"the same language"- meaning an inspiring discussion and á
encounter.

[ I sometimes quarrel with my mother because she blames me, á
though I have not in any way been connected to some events.]

After hearing about the death of my grandfather.  First I could á
not believe it, but later I wept and felt the situation was á
hopeless.  I felt lonely and wanted to be consolated.

In the evening, while I was watching TV, my little brother came á
in and started eating food he had brought from the kitchen while á
I was trying to concentrate on the program.

My little brother was arrested by the police at the railway station after á
he had drunk some beer.

At my temporary job, I have to restrict  others' actions and make á
them obey me, and this very often gives me  a feeling of guilt.  I á
wish there could be some other way of acting.

I met a dear friend of mine after a long time.  I expressed my feelings á
in our own usual way, by mutual scolding and abusing (with á
complete understanding) and by touching, patting and taking the á
hand of the other person, etc...

I felt fear of the purest kind after a car accident.  The á
incident and images of horror kept coming back to my mind.  I á
wondered what could have happened to my sister, my friend and me, á
though nothing very serious actually happened.

Two boys whom I know were telling me, in an indecent manner, how á
they had teased a young and shy girl I know.  They had despised á
her conviction, scorned and touched her.  I got very angry and á
did not try to conceal it and gave it back to them.

My sweetheart left me, or rather we decided to break it off by á
mutual consent.  The consequences were - unrestrained weeping, á
feelings of loneliness, hopelessness and disconsolation.  I felt á
that I should find a friend, to talk to joyfully and to forget.

Out of sheer curiosity, I went to see a pornographic movie in á
Copenhagen.  The room was full of men, who panted and á
masturbated.  Very disgusting.

After having quarelled unnecessarily and without any reason, and á
having been stupidly cross in every way.
[ Do not know.]
Forced to fill in a questionnaire.
When I won a tennis match.
When my dog ran out on thin ice last spring.

When my tennis match was interrupted because a kid cycled right á
into the court.
[ No response.]
[ No response.]
[ No response.]
[ No response.]

Celebrations on the graduation day with the orchestra playing in á
the garden ( I am a part of this orchestra).
Risk of being involved in a fight after a party.

I had a very heavy work load and two colleagues, whom I have á
nothing against, disturbed me by "terror ringing", i.e á
continously interrupting me by telephoning.
After an exam which I failed.
[ Normally I do not feel disgusted.]

When I overtook a car on the mainroad, misjudging the distance of á
an oncoming car and this resulted in tooting and flashing from á
the other driver (we could have collided), and I had an á
acquaintance in the car with me.

I saw a neighbour, from the same appartment block as me, lying    á
on the road.  He could have been injured or ill.  I kept 20 á
metres away and did not go to help him.

When I met an old schhol friend (school love) who works in á
Sk+vde.

When I was cycling to school, I nearly got knocked down by a car á
which (overtook me too closely) did not give me any swerving space.

When I was deputy manager during the Summer, certain deputies á
took liberties, more than what was normal.

When I realized that my girlfriend, whom I like, and I were going á
to separate.
Dog dirt which thaws in the spring.
When I forgot my mother's birthday.
[ Can not think of anything just now.]
Passed the last exam.
Was nearly knocked down by a car.

I reached the bus stop and realized that I had forgotten my bus á
pass.

My current work load is too much.  The feeling comes back from á
time to time.
[ Can not think of any situation.]
[ No response.]
[ No response.]
When my one year old son gives me a spontaneous kiss.
When someone close to me is travelling by car and is delayed.
When someone does something wrong which affects me negatively.
When I think about my parents getting old.
[ Can not remember.]
[ No response.]

I do not have the time for other people's problems.  My á
mother-in-law is sometimes depressed and I do not have the time, á
the desire or the strength to help.

An ex-colleague asked me if I was interested in working in their á
accounts bureau.  They needed "clever people" and he had á
"immediately thought of me."

I was driving and a deer suddenly appeared in front of the á
car when there was a lot of traffic behind me.
I saw a report on T.V news on apartheid in South Africa.
[ No response.]
[ No response.]
[ No response.]
[ No response.]
When my girlfriend became pregnant.
When I nearly collided with another car.
The time when someone let the air out of the tyres of my cycle.
When I read a lot and did not remember anything.
[ No response.]
[ No response.]
The time that I had to put my dog to sleep.
[ No response.]
[ No response.]
[ No response.]
Long illness.
When I passed an exam.

When I was travelling by tram, I tripped and fell against the á
door.  I thought that I was going to fall out.
When I missed the tram after having run for it.
The inability to read a book at college.
If a guy one is not interested in makes advances.
I drink wine too often.
I do not study enough as I do not understand it properly.

I worked at a lawyer's office during Summer and I got a very á
good reference from him.

I had been watching a triller a dark night in the country and I á
had to go the outside toilet on my own.

When I am accused of something I have not done, I get unbelievably á
angry.

When I began to read a thick book, which I had a limited time to á
read.  Also when I have a lot of work to do and I cannot keep up.
Someone vomited on the street.

I can not think of any incident when I have felt very ashamed.  á
There are small incidents that I am ashamed of, for instance, á
not sending money to the children in Ethiopia.

I had lunch with my ex-boyfriend and did not mention it to my á
fiancee.  I felt guilty despite the fact that I felt nothing for á
my ex-boyfriend.
When I was finally qualified for my profession.
Someone attacked me with a knife.
Someone drove into my car and then denied that it had happened.
When I was told that my friend's wife had cancer.
When I saw a dog which had been knocked down by a car.
When I boxed my child's ears.
When I was fined for speeding.
I stopped working (had a boring job).

I was going home by car late one night when it was cold, dark and á
windy.  I became rather panicky on the way to my house.
Quarrel in the family.

When I am alone in a room with no contact with anyone - á
loneliness drains me.
When I was on holiday someone vomited in front of me.
Emptied a bucket of water in a hospital.
When I feigned sick leave from work.
When I get a hug from someone I love.

I was driving very fast on a small road and I met an oncoming car á
in a right handed bend.  The other driver was on his own side of á
the road and I had to skid out of it to avoid a collision.  It á
was dark.

My car had been towed away by the traffic police because it had á
been wrongly parked.  However the sign had been put up only after á
I had already parked.
After an operation I had to stay in bed for a long time.

I was forced to stay in the canteen and eat the food that I had á
not asked for but got it anyway.
When I did not buy what I had promised to.

By mistake I took a book from the library which was not supposed á
to be loaned out.
When I won an unexpected sum of money.

My 2 year old daughter disappeared in a moment of inattention; I á
was responsible for her.

A colleague asked me for some advice and as he did not have á
enough confidence in me he asked a third person.

I wanted to be pregnant and did not succeed, so I was depressed    á
at every menstruation.

In a warm bus full of people, someone vomited and the whole bus á
stank.

I complained about a colleague's behaviour as she goes back on á
her word, is often absent and is irresponsible.  I found out that á
she was an alcoholic and was trying to fight againt her á
addiction.

I spoke to my mother on the phone.  She had skin cancer and was á
waiting to be operated.  I forgot to ask her the date of the á
operation and just before finishing our conversation she gave me á
the date in passing.

When I was at a party I met an old friend from an adult á
education course.  We had not met for 2 years but had both thought á
a lot about each other.  A wonderful experience.á

When I was cycling through the park late one night, two people á
jumped out of the woods and tried to stop me.  There were á
shouting something at the same time.

When close relatives tried to dissuade me from studying á
Psychology because of its low status.

I had a long discussion on politics with an acquaintance.  He á
was more knowledgeable than me and I failed to explain my point á
of view and was misunderstood so I felt depressed and left.

When I read a newspaper article on a young girl who had been á
raped and assaulted one night by several men when she was unconscious.

My mother revealed personal details about me and the á
negative aspects of my character to other people when I was á
present but unable to defend myself.

I was unfaithful to my partner once when he was working abroad á
for a long period.
When I recently got an appartment in central Gottenburg.
When I saw a large spider crawling up the wall.

My employer took too many aspirins for a bad back and also drank á
an enormous amount of spirit.  This was dangerous  and he did á
not understand that he had done anything wrong.
When I left New York, and all my family and my friends behind me.

When I slept with a guy because my best friend wanted me to.  á
He had never had intercourse with anyone and had a terrible á

It was in a tramway-carriage: A stranger insulted a girl just á

While dancing in a restaurant last week.

I was on the Inter Rail in Naples alone. After an evening in a á
restaurant I was going back to the hotel when a prostitute á
approached me to sell herself. I refused but as I carried on á
walking I felt that I was being followed by someone.
When a girl left me.

I was on my way back from the Inter Rail, on board the ferry from á
Stockholm when my father called me at 7 o'clock to tell me that my á
uncle had died and that I would be seeing him off on his final á
journey within four days.

On Reperbahn, in a restaurant, a "charming" old saleswoman came á
to beg a drink for herself.

At the funeral of my uncle, I was one of the bearers.  I was not á
familiar with the etiquette and acted tactlessly because of my á
ignorance.

On Reberbahn, I was in a "restaurant" where drinks were á
overpriced.  I did not ask for the prices beforehand, and when á
the bill came I could not pay the bill.

My girlfriend gave me some feed-back and I understood that it á
meant that our relationship was about to turn even closer.
At the dentist's, waiting for my turn to come.

While in the army, I was treated unfairly by my superiors.  I was á
held responsible for a deed of which I was innocent.

When I came to know that my grandmother had died.  She was very á
close to me.

In the army, an acquaintance of mine tended to use his position á
to advance his own interests.

When I lied to my girlfriend, telling her that I had passed an á
exam, when I actually did not even take it.

When I spoke ill of a fellow worker in the absence of this á
person.

When I look at people around and know that people who are stupid á
look stupid.

When I saw Russian roulette on TV. (obviously the movie "Deer á
hunter")
When stupid people push me during rush time in the city.
[ Laziness makes one sad.]

When I saw hundreds of snakes twisting over one another in a á
movie.

I saw a skid-row (chronical) alcoholic and I was ashamed of the á
people with a high standard of living.
When I shot a bird in the head with a shotgun.
[ Being close to another person.]
[ Uncertainty about my own abilities in an exam.]
[ An unfair punishment.]
Loneliness, being uncertain of myself in the Autumn.
A rich man expressing disgust towards an alcoholic.

A man asked me: "May I sleep in your stairway?"  and I answered á
"No".
[ The same as in shame.]

I went to a doctor with a complaint. The doctor told me that I á
was completely healthy.

My father was away from home and he did not come back when he was á
expected, he came back several hours later than expected.

I had an implicit agreement with my sister about meeting her, á
however she had not understood the situation the same way so she á
did not turn up.
I realized that the girl I loved had to leave me.

In the bus I was sitting next to a colleage who was drunk and á
behaved in keeping with his state.

I had promised to help out with domestic chores and I forgot á
about it.
I had promised to call a girl but I did not do it.

When I unexpectedly received birthday greetings from a person I á
like.

I returned home late from a party last night and I felt afraid á
trying to anticipate the reaction of my father.
When I learned that my brother had spoilt an LP of mine.

When I came to know that a girl I was fond of already had a á
boyfriend.
A too eager approach by a dirty drunken person in a bus.

I made a major mistake while learning how to use a computer programme á
and the teacher criticized me.

I reproached my mother's cooking and criticised her á
personality, and she felt hurt and depressed.
I shot the decisive goal in an ice-hockey match.

When I got lost in New York city a late friday night with a á
friend of mine.
After having quarelled with a relative of mine about politics.
The death of my grandmother.

When I noticed that a nice person was being exploited á
economically.
I slandered a person behind his back and he got to know about it.

I had quarelled with a friend of mine and I later realized that á
it was also my fault.

I passed an exam which I was not sure at all to pass.  I rejoyced á
at the result because the possibility of continuing my studies á
depended on it.

In the traffic with a car, I nearly got crushed between a bus and á
a tram.  The attention of other drivers saved me at the last moment.

I was disappointed and angry at the bad quality of a documentay á
program on TV.  In my opinion, the topic was important and the á
program should have been made with seriousness and consideration.

My father had a heart attack when I was not at home (I was still á
living with them).  He recovered relatively well although he had á
to retire (which implied relief from the stress of a small scale á
enterprise).

At my grandmother's detestable and selfish conduct towards my á
elder sister, although her behavior was due to senility and lack of á
understanding.

I arrived late at a seminar concerning my major subject at á
university, although I had been appointed to formally oppose the á
paper which was being presented.

I had asked the Salvation Army to take away a piece of furniture á
of mine, but I forgot to cancel the agreement (a friend of mine á
took it) and I thereby caused the Salvation Army people some á
unnecessary work.

On the cliff by the sea, the silence and the sudden voice of a á
bird.(swans of the bay)
A dark night when I had to go to the outdoor lavatory.

When I realized that I was far behind the others in the language á
course and I could no longer catch up with the others.

The long lasting illness of my grand-mother, and the changes in á
family relationships caused by it.

Spoilt, smashed and molded potatoes in the fridge, and having to á
clean up the dish later.

A truth expressed unthinkingly at a coffee party.  I realized á
later that I had been inconsiderate, at a wrong moment and the á
wrong place.
I did not go to the exercises, without any adequate reason.

When I got home from my job, I found a letter from the university á
telling me that I had been admitted to begin my studies.

While watching TV (a war movie), I felt a strong fear of death, á
threat and fear of loosing people close to me.

I was angry with a friend of mine who behaved in an affected á
manner.

I made a long-distance call to people rather close to me and I á
thought about the sad incident that had happened to them in the á
near past; I knew that they were thinking about it too when I made á
the call.

My parents inherited an appartment and this made them behave in a á
peculiar manner.
When my friend let my personal matters be publicaly known.

When I think about my family (parents, brothers, sisters) guilt á
is a part of my feelings.

I unexpectedly met a girl with whom I have always got along well. á
( I had not seen her for several months.)
When my father was very drunk and raging at home.

When I did not find the rack used for beating up rugs, in the á
yard.
When one of my cat died of a disease.

I felt disgusted at the environment while getting back to my á
student lodging. I did not see anything in the suburb which had á
been planned by taking people's comfort into account.

My girlfriend was away visiting another city and I brought á
another girl home. Next morning when I started getting sober I á
felt quite ashamed of myself.

I got 100 FIM too much when I changed money at the bank.  They á
soon called me at my job and the situation was embarrasing for á
me.

In Sweden, a friend and I lived in an appartment owned by a Finn. á
 One day, this man came back to the appartment heavily drunk á
(hashish and alcohol).  He was quite dizzy and he broke down, and á
I could not foretell his reactions.  However, nothing happened.

I had an appointment downtown, and the person in question was á
half an hour late.
The death of my grandmother.

In the army, I had been in hospital for two weeks and as soon as á
I returned to the company, a sergeant ordered me to fetch a load á
on the tractor trailer.

On the way back from a Summer spent in Sweden, I drunk with a man á
in the train.  I had drunk so much that when I got home I fell á
asleep in the entrance hall.  I have never drunk that much, á
neither before nor after that incident.  I was ashamed because my á
mother and my sister had to see me in that state and my father á
had to carry me to bed.

While at primary school, I did not let a friend ring a bell á
although he would have liked to do it.  Afterwards I felt bad.
I got a fairly large amount of my taxes back.

I was jogging in the forest, in the central park area, when I saw á
a man hiding behind a tree.  I got frigthened, turned around and á
ran out of the forest.

I was coming home in a taxi with a fellow worker of mine.  He was á
criticizing my earlier conduct towards him, which to my mind was á
unfounded.  When I reached home, I ran out of the taxi and á
slammed the door.

I had had a farewell party at the place where I had been working á
for a year.  That night I could not fall off to sleep.  I was sad á
thinking that I would not see my nice fellow workers again.

I was travelling in a local train when a drunkard, smelling á
terribly, entered the same carriage and started eating fish that á
was stinking.

While quarelling with a fellow worker of mine, I was vehement and á
irritated and I told him what I thought of him in plain language.  á
I was ashamed of myself when I met him the next day.

I was working as a secretary.  My boss was to go to give a á
lecture, and wanted me to give him the exact address of the á
place.
A sunny Autumn day, after a long rainy period.

Years ago, on my way to school by the forest path I came across á
an exhibitionist.

A person close to me mistook my good intentions for bad, and á
therefore associated unpleasant traits to me.

[ A person close to me told me that his positive regard depended á
on my conduct.]

When an untidy and heavyly drunk person made endeavours to á
approach me.

As a little girl, I was sick in the middle of a school day and I á
vomitted in the basin of the classroom.
I lost my self-control and raised my voice at a child.
I got to know that I had been accepted at university.

I had been watching a TV-program on paranormal phenomena.  At á
night I could not fall off to sleep as I feared that humanoids á
were on the move.

My superior blamed me for some neglects at work in front of á
others.  In fact, the task in question was not supposed to be á
done by me.
My father suddenly fell ill and died.

When a friend of mine got drunk and started to blame and scorn my á
other friends and me.
When I forgot a promise made to a friend of mine.

It was my turn to cook dinner.  I forgot a dish (the favourite of á
the family) in the oven and it got burnt and was uneatable.

My joy was the joy of meeting again.  My husband came home after á
having been away for weeks (for work).  I was on the railway á
station to meet him.

I was alone at home and I could hear odd noises coming from above á
our bedroom.  I knew that nobody lived there since it was an á
office.  I got frightened (later I was given a "natural" á
explanation).

A relative of mine had come to see my husband to talk to him á
about a problem concerning his sister and me.  I was angry á
because this relative of mine did not dare to speak to me and á
instead spoke to my husband.  I got to know about it later the á
same day.

The death of my father, even though we had not been very close to á
each other.

The male friend of my mother (a widow) moved in to live with us.  á
I did not like the man.

At school I was talking to a classmate about mathematics.  I had á
grown weary of it and said : "I would like to throw the book on á
the arse of Kuikka".  My classmate said : "Now, he is sitting á
there and waiting for the book" (Kuikka was one of the most quiet á
boys of the class).  I was ashamed of myself.

The death of my father made me feel quite guilty, because my á
attitude towards him had been cold and indifferent.

My mother, sister and I were thinking about old times, our á
childhood, and we had a very happy time.

My husband had gone to drive a strange, broken car.  At the á
agreed time, he had not returned, and I feared that he had had an á
accident.

I am a school teacher.  One of the classes does not obey me at all, á
keeps on talking, does no work.  One afternoon, everything went á
wrong, and I got exceedingly angry.

A young, close relative of mine died, leaving behind a baby a few á
months old.

A series about Freud was shown on TV.  In it, a tampon had been á
set in the nose of a woman, and forgotten there.  After great á
pain it was taken off (close-up picture), the woman was bleeding á
from the nose and the mouth.

I had promised to lend something to my mother-in-law and I forgot á
it a couple of times.  When she asked me about it the third time, á
I was ashamed at my absent-mindedness.

A borrowed car broke down while I was using it.  It was not my á
fault, nevertheless I felt guilty.

I started a new branch of studies after having failed a former á
one.  When I got back my exam papers I was very happy to know á
that I almost had full marks.

I was diving below the ice, in a cave, at a depth of 26 metres.  á
Visibility was almost zero and the oxygen level decreased á
threateningly.  There were three of us divers on one safety rope.

My mother carried on using mental pressure concerning something á
which was serious and a real burden to me.
My grandfather died, I went to the mortuary and saw the corpse.
[ The same as in anger.]
As a child when I was blamed for peeing in the swimming-pool.

A friend of mine was drunk and having an argument on the street á
with a woman, appparently his girlfriend.  I was walking on the á
other side of the street and thought that I was not supposed to á
interfere.  Later I heard that he had shot himself that evening.
My girlfriend sent me a letter with a shiny picture in it.

I was about to begin a journey in a car with an acquaintance of á
mine.

On the TV news I heard that Nicaragua had complained about the á
increasing threat of war with the USA.
My girlfriend gave me the mitten (left me).
Watching a violent movie.
The morning after a wild party.

I "picked up" a girl and I thought that I had misused my á
position and authority over her as there did not seem to be any á
realistic possibility of continuing the relationship.

When, to my surprise, I got to know about having got "very good" á
high school graduation marks.

My grandmother was about to die, and it had the effect that at á
night, after having read a book, and once in bed, in perfect á
darkness, the fear arose that I too may suddenly die.

When I checked my examination paper and realized that I had been á
careless, thoughtless, lazy and hasty so as to make unnecessary á
mistakes concerning things I know and understand.

When we decided, my boyfriend and I, that we would separate, I á
realized that he would have wanted to continue our relationship á
and the coming separation hurt him.

When an acquaintance of mine told me about the way his parents á
treated their sons in an unequal manner.  The most successful of á
them got continuous encouragement, and the youngest was not á
encouraged and was rejected.

I was talking to a friend of mine about our parents and á
education.  I said something and then realized that I did not á
know my friend's parents, their motives and education.  I felt á
ashamed at having talked about something I did not know anything á
about.

My mother told me that the enveloppes that I had been tearing (I á
had torn the stamps away) in good faith had been the first-day á
enveloppes which my father had collected as a young man.

I am not especially good at English, and after the high school á
graduation exam in English I tensely waited for the result the á
whole day.  In the evening, when I heard that I had done á
excellently, I became very happy and the anxiety vanished.  My á
family was at home.

I feared that I was pregnant.  It was not planned and I would á
have been compelled to have an abortion, which I would not have á
liked at all.  Fortunately, after a week's anxiety, I got to know á
that I was not pregnant.

A member of a religious sect tried to convert me, using really á
evil tricks to persuade me.  After he had left, I was anxious and á
angry for a long time. After the event, I was alone.
When my boyfriend wanted to leave me, I felt sad and melancholic.

In a film, there was an episode where they used a chain saw to á
cut a man.  I could not look at it, but I could not avoid á
listening either.  I sought shelter in my boyfriend's arms.

I thought I would be able to use the mangle of the house, and so á
I did not want any help.  However, I blocked it and I had to get á
the janitor to help me out.  He reproached me for not having á
followed the instructions

I promised my friends that I would take care of something, but I á
kept forgetting about it.  When they asked me about it, I á
promised to do it immediately.  However, I got started only after á
a couple of months.  I felt that I had betrayed my friends.

When I got an unexpected letter from  a guy, who had been my school á
mate.

When my brother went to shoot wild ducks, I feared that the á
boat would overturn and he would drown or that the gun would á
accidentally go off.

My father had once again told me that I should be careful and try to á
seek admission to other places also apart from the faculty of á
Social Sciences at the university of Helsinki.  I was not at all á
interested in any other place and had no time to study for other á
entrance exams.

I would have liked to go out to chat with some acquaintances, but á
I realized that I was not wanted.  I felt hurt, disappointed, á
lonely and deserted.

When an acquaintance (he was drunk) of my room-mate vomitted on the kitchen á
carpet.  It was past mid-night and my room-mate had just moved in, á
this acquaintance had helped her move in.á

I was carried away while talking about my visits abroad and I á
tended to boast a little, till I realized that the listener was á
amused.

When I was baby-sitting at my cousin's place, I tried to have a á
pleasant time and did not really take care of the child.  I do á
not care very much about children.

When I got 21/30 points in an exam of statistics. The result was á
unexpected and it made me realize that statistics do not á
surpass my abilities, as I have sometimes thought.

When a big angry dog put its snout on my arm and had I made one á
movement it would have bitten me.

When my room-mates were watching video-tapes and prevented me á
from watching the news.  The first feeling I had was that I was á
being treated unfairly and then came the feeling of anger.

[ When after a night of sleeping in another's arms, one wakes á
alone and knows that the lonely arms of the night are not the á
same that one meets in the morning.]

When an unpleasant person tried to make friends with me.  A á
subtle, small, insignificant, grey being whose helplessness and á
neutrality evoked the feeling of disgust in me.

Badly chosen words to a vague acquaintance of mine made me feel á
ashamed at having given the wrong impression about what I wanted á
to say.  Thoughtlessness.

When I behaved improperly - fought in a public place.  á
Afterwards, I felt guilty about my conduct.

When my friend told me that he would come and meet me in a á
moment.

My father had been drinking and I feared him when we went to bed á
at night.

My friends promised me that they would definitely call me to tell á
me if they were visiting me or not.
A close friend of mine had not contacted me for a long time.
A friend of mine came to see me when he was quite drunk.
I said something especially stupid which I did not mean at all.

I did not go to help a friend of mine, though she probably needed á
me.

When I felt that an exam, which I had feared, was an easy one and á
went well.

I was afraid when my dog ran out through a crack in the fence á
when  a train was coming.

When a friend of mine was drawn into a fight because of the á
stupid gang he belonged to. I felt angry with him and his á
friends. They could not think about anything sensible, but would á
fool around without taking into consideration the feelings of á
other persons.á

I felt sad after having had an argument with my boyfriend.  I felt á
that he did not understand me and that there was no point in á
carrying on with the relationship.

I detested my father who was a drunkard.  He would rave, á
threaten and blame my mother and me.  He finally drove us away á
from home.

When I was on holiday with my former boyfriend, he hit me and á
behaved in a very evil and ugly manner in front of the hotel á
personnel.

When as a child I stole, from a friend of mine, the ring she had á
got in an easter egg.

When I got home from a pleasant trip abroad, I got to know that I á
had been accepted at university.

At school, I had acted against the will of the group, and the á
next day they promised to take revenge on me.

My mother had for some time been trying to separate me from a á
good friend who, she thought, was not good company for me.  á
Finally, at breakfast one day, we had an argument and I tried to á
defend my friend.
I got to know about the death of a close friend.

When I was watching a movie with many violent episodes.  They á
accurately showed the cutting of corpses, etc...

When I was caught telling a white lie.  At that time, I was not á
allowed to stay outdoors after 8 p.m.  One day when I was late, I á
made up a story that our neighbour had invited me to his place, á
though I had actually forgotten about the time while playing with á
my pals.

When before the last exam I have taken, I went out instead of á
studying.

When I was pressing figures on the curtain cloth. I had bought á
the cloth after months of hindrances.

I am a kindergarten teacher and I am thoroughly weary of my job.  á
After having taken the university entrance exam I suffered from á
anxiety for weeks as I did not want to carry on with my work - studies á
were the only alternative.

My life-partner, who was drinking more and more, spoke about á
kicking the cat.  He had never done anything of the kind, but I á
knew that he would do so one day, without thinking about it.

Estrangement from my best woman friend.  We have been going á
different ways for quite some time now, but the break was total á
when she got married as her husband is unreasonably jealous of me.

My life-partner is going through a crisis (way of life, old-fashioned values) á
and can only get out of it by talking bold decisions.  I have á
noticed his cowardice and attempts to escape his problems by á
drinking.  I detest his drinking and his being full of self-pity.

Again, a quarrel had come up in our difficult relationship.  My á
life-partner threw all the books off the shelf.  I am sure that it á
disturbed our neighbours since this happened late in the night.

A lonely, neurotic, shy girl lives nearby. She has expressed a á
wish to meet me, I have however avoided her (turned down an á
invitation) as the crisis my partner is going through uses up all á
my empathy.

Begining the week-end with my girlfriend : cozyness, beer and á
wine.

The fear about my future : work, making ends meet and health. á
Coping.

A friend of mine ridiculed me, telling me that I would never á
accomplish anything. I felt that he had interfered with my life.

I felt sad at having to leave my girlfriend after constant problems á
and failed attempts at reconciliation.  My sadness was caused by á
the irreversibility of the decision.
A man spat on the wall of a house.

In an express bus I sat on a seat meant for senior citizens and á
invalids.

When I did not succeed in finding a job after having finished a á
nonacademic degree.

When after an overwhelming anxiety and enquiry, I understood á
something about why I exist and what my task in life is.

At the railway station, while waiting for the last train at night á
I noticed that a drunk young man was appraching me in a á
purposeful mannner.

While having a discussion with my mother, I realized that she á
does not for a moment doubt the justification of her making the á
decisions concerning my life.

When I think that I will probably never have a genuine contact á
with my parents.

While reading Olli Jalonen's new book, the distant, cold and á
selfish relationships between people (in the book) made me feel á
disgusted.
When I approached a person of the opposite sex and was rejected.

When I noticed that my little sister was sulking, because I could á
not meet her because of a misunderstanding.

The day I got to know that I would get a shared dwelling with my á
boyfriend.  My parents place was getting a little crowded with á
my growing bother wanting a room to himself.  I first felt doubt, á
then joy, but also sadness.  The feeling of joy was the á
strongest.

My grandfather had lung-cancer and was being nursed at á
home.  I felt fear when I was alone with him and he almost choked á
on mucus secretions.

The outrageous conduct of a relative towards me and those close á
to me.(blaming us and lying)
We had to finish the life of our 8 year-old dog.
A very drunk person.

An argument that grew out of an ordinary conversation with a á
person very close to me, when we should have been having a good á
time together.

While trying to get my little brother over a ditch, he fell on á
his head and started crying.  I was scared of having caused him á
permanent injury.
[ A chat on the telephone with a friend.]

[ Meeting some new (unpleasant) people or some new, demanding á
situation.]
[ For example, unfair pushing in a bus.]
[ When I am, in my opinion, not understood correctly. ]
[ When some people act very important in any situation.]

[ Generally, when I am late in attending to matters (for example á
paying bills).]

[ If one has planned to do something "important" and then, for á
some reason, fails to do it.]

I was in a dancing-tavern and the atmosphere was one of waiting á
for the end of the world.  Suddenly people began dancing wildly, á
inspired by the band.  An unbelievable experience : wonderful á
that even Finns sometimes flare up and forget to think "what á
others are thinking of me".  It was delightful to dance to one's á
heart content.

I was travelling back home by boat with two friends of mine after á
a lovely holiday trip.  The night and the sea were dark, and the á
wind was blowing.  I feared that death was there on the boat, I á
somehow felt sure about it.  I feared being left alone.

I was at home, filling my tax report.  Nobody had time to help á
me.  I would have liked to do it quickly so that I could go and á
meet a friend of mine who had just returned from hospital.  I got á
angry as both my brother and my father refused to give me their calculator á
as I had not asked for it nicely.  I could not leave as I á
had to wait for help and the tax report had to be done.

I tried to talk to my parents over the phone, as I wanted to go á
home for the week-end and I knew that I would not be able to bear á
it.  I tried to reduce the gulf and the conflict between us by á
talking in order to unite our worlds.  Result : hysterical mess, á
blinding and blaming.

My mother called me because she had read through the enveloppe a letter á
addressed to me.  She denied having read it intentionally and á
said "the words just popped out through the enveloppe as the sun á
was shining on it". Hah Hah.

I feared that I would have to describe my sexual life to an á
older, strange woman.
When I moved away from home.

The inflammation of the ear of my child got cured and the doctor á
said that the ear was completely all right.

My husband suddenly fell ill seriously and during the medical á
examinations we did not know what would follow.

The housing council asked the city to cut 40 linden trees so that á
the inhabitants of the lower floors would have a view to the sea.

My child, unexpectedly started acting in a restless and á
disturbing way at school.  In addition his performance at school á
weakened.

On a trip abroad, a lady-like member of our group turned out to á
be an alcoholic.  She spoilt many days of my holidays because of á
her behaviour and paranoia.
I failed an exam which I thought I would certainly pass.

I had been guilty of gossiping and blaming others, and one of my á
superiors at the workplace made a formal reprimand.
When a student of mine (at music) performed and played remarkably well.
When climbing up the stairs to the top of a ski-jumping hill.

My boy-friend came home late one night without having told me á
about it before.
The breaking up of a long lasting relationship.

While watching the movie called "Deer hunter" on TV, when it á
showed how prisoners were treated.

When I noticed that a person I found attractive had seen me á
picking my nose.

When I think that I have been too stict or narrow minded towards á
my students.

When I made up with a girl-friend of mine after having been on á
unfriendly terms with her (my fault).  I cried with joy that á
evening.

While cycling in the country, I came across a large herd of á
cows.

When I heard that my step-mother had treated my mother in a wrong á
manner.

When my friend did not pass the high school graduation á
examinations.

When I heard about the advances an acquaintance of mine had made á
to my friends, who did not approve of them.

When after having had sexual intercourse with a friend, I thought á
that he had told about it to a friend of his.
When I promised a male friend of mine to visit him, and did not.

During lectures, I sensed an unexpressed understanding with a boy á
I did not know.  We exchange glances ; I think he likes me, and I á
like him too.  Perhaps he has fallen in love with me .........

At night, I walk home past a forest.  Once, somebody got stabbed á
in the forest.  I imagine someone attacking me and I hurry up.

In a tram, the ticket seller was commanding, taking the role of a á
leader, trying to emphasize her non-existent authority with undue á
strictness towards a good-humoured drunk who could not find his á
ticket at once.

A relationship in which I had put my trust, broke up.  I was sad á
when I realized how easy it is to forget something that one had á
once regarded as great and significant.

A nightmare.  I was dreaming about bloodsuckers, which I tried to á
shake off from my body, they are everywhere, they get glued, they á
suck.  And there are a lot of them.  I panic.

I told evil lies about a close friend of mine.  I was evil in á
order to sound jolly, to charm a person whom I wanted to impress. á
 I sold my friend, I was despicable.

I met my ex boyfriend by chance.  We separated a few months ago á
and I am now with a new boyfriend.  My ex boyfriend looked á
depressed, and I know I am not to be blamed.

[ During inter-rail-trip, after troubles, I met my little á
sister.]

Traveling as the only female in a railway carriage in the middle á
of the night in Italy.
A male, Honduran acquaintance of mine despised my opinions.
When our dog died.

While walking on the street with a good friend of mine, we met an á
acquaintance of hers.  My friend started showing off and telling á
false stories about herself and praising herself.

I was dishonest to my boyfriend concerning something that is á
important to our relationship.
A parking fine.

After having at last finished my master's thesis, I felt great á
joy and relief.  I had been haunted by the thesis during the á
whole of my studies.

While preparing my master's thesis, I was scared that I would not á
accomplish anything as the subject was rather difficult.

During the Summer, at my workplace, a person kept interfering á
with my tasks and making unfounded remarks.  I felt hatred for á
him but it stopped when I realized that he just longed for attention.

The last time I felt sad and disappointed was when I did not do á
as well as I had hoped in one of the final exams.  As compared á
with the earlier exams, the questions, I think, were unjust.

After the first of May, I detested my fiance's friends, who had á
piled on to our party and spoilt it completely.

After our sad first of May party, I felt ashamed because the á
friends who had been invited had to suffer.  We, the organizers á
of the party, did not drive the intruders away.

At my summer job, I was responsible for making various orders.  á
It was not me who had ordered some seasonal merchandise, but when á
much of it was left over and had to be thrown away in the Autumn, á
I felt partly responsible for the much too large order.
When I met a good friend of mine after a long time.

I was camping with a friend of mine and we spent the night in the á
forest.  I could not fall off to sleep and could clearly hear á
noises from outside (steps ?) approaching our tent.
When I quarelled with my parents.

Being away from a very close friend, I was away from Finland á
for a year as an exchange student.
When I saw a spider.

While playing I urinated on grandma's floor and did not go to the á
lavatory.  My cousin told grandma and she came.
While travelling in a bus with an invalid ticket, I got caught.

While having a discussion with a colleague of mine, I realized that her á
conception of man and work were similar to mine.

While he was drunk, my life partner tried to hit me.  I felt á
scared and fled to the bathroom.

A "higher status" colleague of mine despised my attitude and á
organization of work.

I could not meet my love, after having waited for a month, due to á
illness.
Once again, my life partner came back home drunk at midnight.

My love and me rented a room in a hotel one evening.  We stayed á
there a few hours and when leaving the hotel, I felt ashamed.

[ I had, by being silent, disapproved my love and made him á
unhappy.  He had not been able to keep his promise.  I thus was á
thinking about my own conduct towards another person.]

I had just moved to the town where I study and I got a postcard á
from a good friend (from my home town).

My boyfriend hinted over the phone about wanting to "be free".  á
He thus did not say it point blank, silence followed.
They had returned much less of my taxes than I had expected.
After my boyfriend and I had separated.

In the morning, the cat of my landlady had vomited on the floor, á
near the staircase I take to go to the bathroom.

My boyfriend's mother, whom I had not met earlier, made an á
unexpected visit.  I was lying lazily on the bed, reading a á
newspaper and my boyfriend was studying.

The cat of my landlady escaped through the window which I had á
left open.

I got a letter from my best friend, whom I had not heard from for á
a long time (a good letter).

Someone knocked on the door when I was alone at home (though á
there was a door bell).  I looked through the peep hole but it á
had been covered.  I called my sister but she could not help me á
as she was hundreds of kilometres away.

My parents put pressure on me to buy clothes, when I would not á
have liked to do so.

When my grandfather died, I saw my grandmother crying against my á
aunt's shoulder (I had never seen my grandmother cry before).

At school, I detested the spinach gruel which had lumps of flour á
in it.

I told some acquaintances of mine something that I regretted á
later.

[ I speak harshly to my parents though they only mean my own á
good.]
When I got a letter from home.

While cycling in the country a dog started running beside me, á
growling and barking, and trying to bite my foot.

Disagreements with mother.  When I moved from KankaanpSS, she had á
promised to help me move but broke her promise because of some á
hindrance.

When I had to move away from home to study, and I knew that I á
would not be coming back home for a long time.

When I noticed two spiders running on the floor in different á
directions.

When I realized that I had been wrong about a person close to me, á
because of pre-set ideas and prejudices.

When I reproached my friend because I was myself low-spirited and á
disappointed.
I found myself a place after looking for one for a long time.
[ In an aeroplane.]

I was angry at my boyfriend who had promised to come to see me á
but did not because he spent the evening with his pals.

The breaking up of a relationship.  We decided that the á
relationship could not carry on, so it was no surprise to me. á
And anyhow, I had known it would happen sooner or later.
The disgust I feel towards a certain person.
After an event in which I felt that I had acted unfairly.

At my job, I got disproportionately angry with a child.  My á
reaction was not as it should have been.

I went to see the entrance examination results at university.  I á
rejoyced at my success.

I borrowed a car which was supposed to be used for a long journey á
a few hours later, and one of the tyres burst in the middle of á
the town and I did not know what to do.

An utterance, which I had intended to be a joke, was taken as an á
offence.  In my opinion, this was stupid, and I got angry.

My best friend had a relatively severe illness.  I was sad á
because she was suffering.

A man tried to have sexual intercourse with me, though I had á
communicated my unwillingness.  Later on, I felt disgust at that á
person as well as myself because I had partly submitted.

I told my friend about how I had calculated my salary by cheating a á
little.  When my friend remarked about it, I understood that it á
was wrong to do so, and I felt ashamed.

I am going steady with a boy, but I had sexual intercourse with á
another one, and I felt guilty about it afterwards.
A good report card (a scholarship) in primary school.

I was walking home with a friend at night along a quiet street.  á
Something started rustling in the bush : it was an exhibitionist.

I got angry at a friend of mine whom I caught reading my notebook á
(almanach).
When my grandmother died of cancer.

In a lift a drunken, fat and untidy man tried to make advances at á
me.

[ Sometimes I have by accident said to another person something á
in which it is easy to read a negative attitude.]

For the sheer pleasure of it, I quarelled with my boyfriend who was trying  á
to be especially kind to me.
When I made the acquaintance of a certain person.
When abroad, while driving a car along a dark, winding road.

When my sister took my things without having asked for my permission á
first.
When my grandfather died.

When I was working, I got treated in a way which I felt was not á
democratic.

While working as a domestic helper, one day I had not cleaned up á
very well and they made a remark about it.

When I decided to move away from my parent's home, my mother told á
me that it was as if a part of her had been torn out of her.

When I went to a job interview, I met a person who was very nice, á
and his attitude made me glad.

My episode of fright happened when I came to study.  I had to á
stand in front of my still unknown fellow students and talk about á
myself.  My hands shook, I flushed and became tongue-tied.

I felt guilty when I spent a night at my boyfriend's place, á
particularly because I had been harsh and spiteful when I had á
left home.  The reason was that I feared a possible discussion on á
the subject and I wanted to leave defiantly.

I was in a restaurant with my boyfriend when I saw my best female á
friend after not seeing her for two weeks.  We rejoyced, hugged á
and had a long talk.

One evening, while going to meet a friend of mine, I had to cross á
a meadow by a dark road.  There were bushes on the other side of á
the road.  The weather was damp and a bit foggy.  I heard steps á
behind me and kept speeding up my steps all the time.

My brother told me that a person (whom I know) had insulted him.  á
I am very fond of my brother, and as he himself can not get angry á
or hurt, my protectiveness was aroused and I got angry.

My guinea-pig had been ill for a couple of days.  One evening, á
when I came home I enquired as to how it was doing.  My mother's á
expression told me that it had died.  My knees refused to support á
me and I began to weep convulsively.

I happened to see two boys fighting, one of them fell down and á
hurt his head.  The other one used this to spank the head of the 
boy on the ground.

I had been away all night without having told my parents about á
it.  In the morning when I came home, my mother looked tired.  á
She said that she had been awake all night because of me and that á
she was angry and disappointed.

I had not written to, or called my grandmother, who was lonely, á
for a long time.  My mother asked me to call her on her behalf á
and when I did so, my grandmother was delighted and she told me á
that she had been waiting for some news from us.
When I was sick my husband bought me a piece of cake.

I saw a man who had had a heart-attack and who was being á
treated for it.  I feared that my own father could have been á
there.
When I saw a big man hit another one, and nobody did anything.

When my sister left to go home, in Sweden, after the Christmas á
Holidays.

I once watched the series called "Dynasty" on TV, and I detested á
it.

I feel guilty as I am not working, and even my studies are not á
progressing.

When my red-cheeked, content child runs to meet me in the yard of á
the kindergarten and gives me a moist kiss on my cheek.

A neighbour's girl had disappeared and many people were looking á
for her.  Someone had gone to notify the police.  Something had á
certainly happened to her.

Without my permission, my son had made popcorn after coming back á
from school.  The consequences were a spoilt kettle and chaos in á
the kitchen but what could have happened with the hot grease ?
The death of a close relative.

One of my fellow students used questionable and unfair means to á
advance her studies faster than others.  I detested her.

My friend told me in a fairly loud voice the blunders she á
committed last night.

I stopped my car in front of a pedestrian crossing as a child was á
crossing the street.  The car driving in the next lane did not á
stop and the child got hurt.  Had I not stopped ...

After my vacations, one day after a lecture it occured to me to á
buy a rose for my mother.  We went together to a pub and my á
mother told me that she would be getting married next Spring.  I á
did not known about it and so was all the more glad.

I work at a day care centre, and one day when the children were á
outdoors a four-year old boy disappeared from the yard.  I was á
not looking after them then, but as the manager it was me who was á
responsible.

I was on vacation, and therefore I did not attend a meeting of á
the day care centre.  Nevertheless, the very day I came back they á
called me early morining to ask me "what are you going to do á
about the matter ?" (which had been discussed in the meeting).  á
Then I got angry.

The fact that my mother is getting married again (my mother and á
father divorced about 15 years ago) means that she will probably á
move to Turku, and our home, which is a one family house, will be á
sold (I myself have not been living at home for the past six á
years).

While travelling in a bus, there were three people sitting behind á
me (two men and a woman).  They were drunk and the conversation á
was unbelievable (about fucking, fellatio, etc...).  They tried á
to get others to take part in the conversation.  I loathed it and á
felt like crying.

When I was seven years old, I stole a chewing-gum from a big á
glass bowl on the counter of a nearby shop, and I got caught.

I am the secretary of an association, and during the last meeting á
I forgot to take the minutes.

I had been away from home for a long time and when I came home I á
was delighted.  It was wonderful to see familiar, dear people and á
I was rejoycing in advance.  I had been feeling very lonely.

I awoke at night and did not remember dreaming about antthing in á
particular.  I just felt oppressing fear, it was dark and all the á
others were sleeping.

One winter day I, unwillingly, was outdoors with my younger á
brother (10 years younger than me).  I lost my temper on him and á
wanted to throw my brother down the snow bank we were on.  I á
pushed him but not as hard as I had wanted to. We were alone the á
two of us.

I was on a class excursion, by boat to Stockholm.  At night my á
class mates prepared to clebrate their motive in life which was á
"life is merriment".  I felt depressed about the way they sought á
happiness.

I was on my way home by bus.  A man who had drunk a fair amount of á
alcohol started talking, trying to hug and pat a woman sitting á
next to him.  Fortunately it was not me.
I gave a wrong answer at school.

When my little brother asked me to play with him, I told him that á
I had no time and that I would play with him the next day. á
However, the next day I said the same thing.
When, after a long time, I saw a girl with whom I was in love.
When I was walking on a fairly out-of-the-way street.

A friend of mine had promised to arrange me some tickets for a á
concert which I considered important.  He could not get them the á
way he thought he would, so he gave up the whole thing.
I was sad when I saw that a beautiful girl was not attainable.

I heard somebody talk about studies in a highly enthusiastic á
"student-like" way.

While attending some affairs, which were taking some time, with á
a bank officer, I felt that my clothes and appearance were out of place, too á
raggy.

One evening I went out with some friends of mine, although I was á
supposed to stay at home with my little sister who is 11.

While watching an entertainment program in which there was a clever  á
and amusing sketch.

When I was in the army, a room mate of mine came back from á
furlough and threatened another fellow with a knife.

The last day of school is traditionally celebrated by singing a á
song about all the students who are leaving.  In the song á
about me, there were things which irritated me a lot.

I worked for seven months in a factory, and made friends with a á
fellow worker.  Later, I visited my former fellow workers and was á
told that, while in the army, my friend had shot himself.

The behaviour of a fellow towards me and some others in the army á
was really mean.  I detested this.
I tried to date a girl, but she refused.

While doing some calculation exercises, I neglected a part of it, á
though I had marked it as done.  By chance, I was asked to á
demonstrate this very part on the blackboard.

In the army, my result at the shooting exercises got á
me a three day furlough.

When I was 8 years old, I would usually come home from school á
with my mother in a car.  For the first time I had to take the á
school bus, and I mistook the bus stop and found myself two á
kilometres away from where I lived.  I was very scared, wondering á
how I would get back home.

I read in the newspaper that the Student Lodging Fund was going á
to build new appartments for refugees (in my opinion this is the á
state's affair).  This is when only a fractoin of the students á
can find an appartment.

I lead a rather secure life.  The only thing I can remember is a á
song from the nineteenth century which is against alcohol.  Both á
the melody and the word (although naive) effected my emotions.

Yesterday in the elevator a man started smoking, this is á
something I just can not tolerate.

In primary school I once faltered while answering a question and á
the others started laughing.

[ Generally when I am shopping I feel like I were guilty of all á
the thefts through the year (I have never stolen).]

When my favourite football team made a goal and was about to á
win the Cup of England.

I was less than 10 years old when our neighbour's dog chased me á
to the roof of a small shed and there seemed to be no hope of á
getting away from there.

While playing a ball game, I was just about to make a goal when I á
was thrown off my feet, and I failed to score the goal.

When I heard about the death of Frantois Truffaut, the French motion  á
picture director, on the radio.  I had planned to go and see his á
last film.

I saw a movie called "The Thing", the film directed by John á
Carpenter.  The monster in the film made me feel disgusted.

I had misbehaved at a party and did not wish to meet the person á
in question later.
While playing a ball game, I made a mistake and we lost the game.
When I was in the sauna bath.
I had a dream in which I was an African elephant.

When I came for the lesson, it was cancelled and I had to fill in á
a questionnaire instead.
When my car froze, and I could not start it.
When I saw our computer teacher.

When I was going downhill on skis, and fell down twice the first á
time.
When I was involved in a car crash.
I passed an exam which I thought I had failed.

My mother had not come home at midnight.  She had forgotten to á
tell me about it.  I was very young and all alone at home.

My girlfriend started singing (she cannot sing) and did not stop á
despite my asking her to do so.
When my grandmother died of cancer.

When I was still a child, I saw a horror film on TV in which á
there was a rotten human skull.

As a small boy, I took a coin from an empty taxi cab.  My mother á
saw it and told the driver about it.  I even knew the driver.
When I betrayed my former girlfriend.

New Year's Eve party in the country, I hardly knew a person; my á
partner spent most of the time at the bar. I had little á
opportunity to get to know people because our table was separated á
and my boyfriend's parents were present.

Christmas Eve: there was a tension between my parents, they did á
not even try to restore a harmonic atmosphere. Mother stayed in á
