her room almost the whole day. I felt alone and was very sad.

Father said: If you are pregnant, you will have to procure á
abortion. I was filled with disgust against my father.

I had an intimate relation with my boyfriend, but unfortunately á
we had sexual problems; therefore I deceived him, but I was á
ashamed when I told my friend about it.

I work at a commercial house from 7 to 10 a.m. On a very cold day á
in winter I was late - and let a fellow worker stand in the cold á
for half an hour.

After one year of searching, my friend and I have found a flat we á
are able to pay for.
Car accident in the middle of the night.

At the weekend I wanted to be absent from school because of a á
sports event, but my teacher refused to give me the day off á
because he didn't like me.
When I was six years old, my favourite cat died.

A gigantic spider climbed over my face and what is more - in my á
own flat.

I was very fat and felt absolutely unwell. I was afraid of á
leaving the house and getting to know new people.

I was said to be responsible for my mother getting ill and á
growing thin. I did not realize that it really was my fault until á
several weeks later.

I won a car in a prize-competition. The moment I was informed á
about it, I felt joy.

My sister had to undergo a very complicated operation, her á
eyesight was at stake.
I had a quarrel with my parents; I was convinced to be right.

I heard that a friend had died in an accident; group situation: á
suddenly a friend came in and said "Have you already heard á
that..."; there was a terrible consternation, silence, then á
everybody shouted excitedly "How could that happen...".

Scuffle in a carriage of the underground in Vienna, three drunk á
men thrashed a man in a wheel chair - I watched the scene from á
another carriage.

I put an end to a friendship with a girl - I had only pretended á
love and affection to be able to sleep with her.

A young girl tried to put an end to her life because of lover's á
grief; not until she was in hospital I heard that I had been the á
reason for her action.

In order to be admitted to my final examination, I had to pass á
two examinations. As I had not studied very much, I resigned á
myself to be left behind. Nevertheless I succeeded in these á
examinations.

I had not told my parents about my bad marks in school. One day, á
my father wanted to speak to the teachers. Fortunately I could á
influence my parents to take it easy.

I wanted to go to a friend of mine who had a party; at the moment á
I wanted to leave, my father said I couldn't go because he needed á
me for some work in the afternoon.

A friend of mine, who had repeated a year at school once before, á
did not pass the final examination and had to take it again half á
a year later.

Eco-activists demonstrated against a project to build a power station á
at the Danube in the middle of a lowland forest (Hainburg) and á
the government decided to delay it for another year. When my á
father heard about it, he said that we needed another Hitler.

There was a time when my room looked terribly untidy; just at á
that time my aunt came to see me; fortunately I could prevent her á
from entering the room.

I was supposed to fetch some friends at the bus stop, but I did á
not do it because my father was in a bad mood and I was afraid á
that he would grumble.
My boyfriend returned after a long absence.
My car skidded on the wet street.

I wanted to see a friend, I had been looking forward to it and á
had certain expectations, but he did not pay any attention to me, á
played cards with other people.

A good friend quitted me after he had behaved in a strange á
manner.

In broad daylight I saw an untidy old man pissing and playing á
with his penis in the middle of the town.

Somebody who knows me very well discovered that I had told him a á
lie.

When my boyfriend was away, I flirted with his best friend; I á
felt guilty the next day.

Recently a good friend only called me when he needed something. á
He never said "please" or "thank you" or any other kind word.

My favourite horse died. We had tried our best to save him, but á
it was hopeless, he had to be shot.

I read a book about the sexual phantasies of women; I read about á
a woman having sexual intercourse with a dog.

In our flat the bath-tub is in the kitchen. At the beginning I á
had very intensive feelings of shame when I had a bath and people á
were in the kitchen.

I had to take care of the plants of a friend of mine for several á
weeks. I watered them, but let them stand in a cold room so that á
two of them perished.

When I met a good friend after a long time. We had had a quarrel á
but after two weeks I was really glad to see him again.

When we stayed in Vienna with our class, my friend and I behaved á
incorrectly. Our teacher threatened us with exclusion from á
school.

When I lost my driving license because I had been driving while á
under the influence of alcool.
My mother's death.

When I entered the dissecting room for the first time. I think I á
felt disgusted mainly because of the bad smell of formaline.

I think I felt ashamed for the first time when I entered a night á
club.

During a ski tour with a friend, we two had drunk too much. When á
we went down the slope on ski, I lost my friend who had lost his á
way. I thought that something must have happened to him (he á
finally arrived but after a very long time).

My father stayed abroad for one year. He does not like to write á
letters because he makes ortographic mistakes. I never had a good á
relation to him. He wrote me a letter in which he said that he á
loved me.

When I was a child, I was always afraid of my father. Just when á
he looked at me, I felt frightened.

A colleague asked me to study with her. I could not explain á
things as perfectly as she had expected. So she reacted in an á
aggressive manner.

During the Christmas holidays, I went to see my parents and á
stayed with them for two weeks. After two or three days, we had á
the same conflicts we had had ten years before when I had lived á
with them. They were glad when I left.

Old man in hospital, hollow-cheeked, only one half of his nose á
and glass-eye, rattling breath.

When my father came into the bathroom and saw me standing there á
naked.

I live with my boyfriend, we have a close relationship, I fell in á
love with another man.
When I met my girlfriend - I had not counted on that.

One night I had a feeling that somebody was stealing my car, á
but I was too frightened to go and see.

When we rearranged furniture in our flat and got stuck in a á
chair.
A person died (not really a friend).

Several weeks ago, I had problems with friends, I felt disgusted á
by a friend.

When I was a child, I thought that I had to be ashamed when á
asking and doing certain forbidden things.
When quarreling with friends.

In Southern Tyrol, I was gathering apples, it was a fine day, I á
was not thinking about anything, I felt an overwhelming joy.

My girlfriend and I slept in a lonely hut (we had drunk alcool). á
Suddenly some soil fell on us, then some water. Although we tried á
hard, we could not find out the cause.

I helped my little sister (13 years) learning mathematics. á
Obviously she did not want to understand what I explained and á
started to cry. I grew angry.
When my girlfriend told me that she wanted to leave me.

On a trip I passed by a cellulose factory. It was a fine day, á
beautiful landscape; I observed this factory with disgust.

When I went to a sauna with my father for the first time (I was á
16). When I entered the sauna naked, I felt ashamed for a short á
time.

I came home from a discotheque at half past four in the morning, á
although I had promised my parents to come home at midnight. From á
3 a.m. I felt guilty towards my parents.
A friend I had missed very much came to see me unexpectedly.

On my way through lonely streets I met with a huge stray dog. It á
stopped at some distance and looked at me. I tried to ignore it á
but I was very frightened.

A friend of mine tried to persuade me to go at her place to act á
as a model because she felt too tired. It was a quarter of an á
hour before the appointed time, I had just lied down and did not á
want to go because it was too late anyway. She said that I only á
was talking about looking for work, but if it was possible I á
would not accept it. I was angry about this unjust judgment.

After I had lived with my boyfriend in a foreign country for half á
a year, I saw that it was impossible for me to stay with him (for á
economic reasons). We separated although I loved him.

In a certain book I read about cruelties and violence in prison á
and souteneur circles; I felt especially disgusted when I read á
detailed descriptions of physical and mental torture of less á
powerful people.

When I talked to a psychotherapist for the first time, I started á
to cry; first I talked to him but he did not say anything and á
after a while I was crying.

I went shopping with my mother and sister (17 years old). Mother á
always told my sister what she should buy. Instead of assisting á
my sister in defending herself against mother's interference, I á
just behaved aggressively towards my sister.

When I worked as an "au-pair-girl" in London, I received a call á
from a good friend who told me that she was in London too and á
wanted to see me. I was very glad - after that call and á
especially when I saw her.

It was on St. Claus Day when I was five years old. St. Claus and á
his Devil Servant came to see me. St. Claus' Devil Servant á
rattled with his chain and bowled terribly. I was so frightened á
that my parents had to ask him to leave.

A friend called me and told me that she wanted to come and see á
me. She lived in a village at 50 km distance fom my home town. á
Next morning I expected her but she didn't arrive. As I got á
impatient I called her but her parents told me that she had gone á
skiing. I was very angry because I had cancelled an appointment á
to be able to see her.

When I was eight years old my father was run over by a car. When á
I saw his body I was sad beyond words.

A friend prepared a soup with chicken heads and invited me to eat á
it. I saw the eyes staring at me and the tongues hanging out of á
the bills. I was so disgusted that I felt nausea and had to leave á
the room.

When I had to go to the gynecologist and to sit on that special á
chair, I felt ashamed.

After a terrible quarrel with my family, I withdrew in my room. I á
felt guilty because I had caused this scene by my aggressive á
behavior.

I had the unexpected possibility to see a friend I like very á
much.

I was afraid of a certain examination although I was relatively á
well prepared.

At the hairdresser's, I got two stains of dyestuff on my new á
trousers. These stains are not removable, so I cannot put on the á
trousers again.

In 1977, my grandfather, to whom I had a very close relationship, á
died.
A drunken man forced me to kiss him.

A friend started to insult another person without reason and I á
felt ashamed of her behavior.

I had to call somebody between 12 and 12:30. As I had no á
possibility to call him at this time, I did not do it until 3 á
p.m.

After a one year's stay abroad, I returned home. I was even more á
glad to see how much my family was pleased to see me.

I went home all alone from a restaurant. It was dark, I went very á
fast. Behind me, there were some drunk men who shouted at me. By á
chance, I met some friends who accompanied me.

A friend who shares the room with me, opened the window in the á
morning and left the room the whole day. When I came home in the á
evening, the room was so cold that I couldn't stay there.

When my aunt, whom I had loved very much, died. When I heard á
about her death, I was not as touched as at the funeral. I really á
became conscious of her death at that moment.

A friend told me how he managed to win the sympathy of as many á
people as possible. He said he first listened to what they said á
and then he tried to only say things they would like to hear. á
He would never express his own opinion. I felt really disgusted á
when he told that.

In a restaurant, I made the acquaintance of a boy who always told á
the same things in a very loud voice. I laughed and said to him á
that he always repeated the same things. Some time later I heard á
that he had undergone a complicated brain operation.

After closing the front door I realized that I had left the key á
inside the house. I felt even more guilty since it was not my own á
house but the house of people I hardly knew.

On our way to France, my girlfriend and I went to Verona. By á
chance we met an Italian couple - they gave us two tickets for á
the dress-rehearsal of "Aida". It was a different world for us á
full of fascination. After the representation we ate a phantastic á
pizza in a restaurant near the "Arena".

On a mountain tour, my girlfriend and I passed by an inn. Near á
the house there was a big dog which began to follow us. As my á
girlfriend is afraid of dogs, I had to draw his attention to me. á
He jumped towards my shoulders and wanted to play with me but I á
really did not like that.

I arrived in Vienna in the middle of the night. I asked for some á
silly information - as I realized myself afterwards - and the inquiry  á
clerk reacted in a very arrogant manner.

I had to leave my girlfriend for 4 weeks because of my studies. á
This happens frequently. The last 24 hours before my departure á
are always very depressing.

When I stayed in the house of friends, I washed my face and á
wanted to dry it with a towel. This towel seemed to have been á
used over a long time already. It smelled indefinably awful.

A friend of mine has not very much money. Therefore, once I á
stayed with him and his girlfriend, I bought some meat, but nobody á
wanted to go and prepare it for dinner. My friend said "I thought á
you wanted to invite us for dinner". "Of course", I said, but I á
thought by myself that it must have been enough that I had bought á
it.

It happened when I still went to school: I got closer to a girl á
but I considered it only as an "affair". Only much later I realized á
how painful this must have been for the girl.

When I was informed that a short story I had written had been á
accepted for publication.

Some friends and I were crossing a street when one of my friends á
was seized by a car and thrown aside. I had seen the car coming á
in our direction but I did not have enough time to react and á
prevent the accident.

I wanted to clear up a misunderstanding with a friend that I had á
caused. A third person meddled in our conversation, turned my á
efforts to ridicule so that I did not succeed in what I had á
intended.
Death of my grandmother.

In school I had difficulties mith mathematics. When I had to work á
for an examination, I really felt disgusted.

I played in a stage play. Suddenly, in front of 200 people, I á
could not remember the words I had to say.

One night I did not come home without telling my parents and I á
did not want to speak about it afterwards. My mother cried. I had á
a bad conscience and felt guilty.
After 3 weeks I saw my girlfriend again.

One evening, in the tramway, I was afraid of two drunk men á
molesting my girlfriend and me.

I went singing with a group of young people on January 6th (The á
three Magi), a local custom called "star singing". One of the girls, my á
girlfriend, broke the star. Being the accompanying person, I felt very á
angry thinking of the consequences.

When the grandmother of my friend died in a hospital. My friend á
was crying and I was sad, too.

I saw a physically handicapped young man whose spittle ran out of á
his mouth while speaking.

It was in a group situation: suddenly it was my turn to say something, 
but I felt that I was not able to express myself very well - I felt á
ashamed and blushed.

My girlfriend's results in school had become worse because I á
prevented her from learning (we often went out etc.).

I went shopping with my parents - my father payed everything for á
me, I was very glad.

When I was a child, I heard the floor cracking and I thought á
there was a burglar in our house; I hid under the blanket and á
trembled.

During a lecture, a colleague who did not know anything about the á
subject, got on my nerves asking silly questions.

When my grandfathers died and I realized how much I would miss á
them.

During a football game, another player who was perspiring very á
strongly ran into me.

I tried to pass an examination particularly well, but I did it á
worse than ever. I felt ashamed.

During the military service, I lost a part of an equipment; I á
accused another person and he was rebuked and punished.

At a choral concert I appeared as a solist. The concert5 was very á
good, I forgot all the hard work that had been done before. There á
remained only an undescribable joy and a feeling of warmth, á
security etc.

I am a "cantor" - I sing psalms in church. Several weeks ago I á
had to sing too, but the organist did not tell me in time. As I á
did not know the psalm, I was afraid and said that I could not á
sing.

During the Christmas holdidays I wanted to invite my brother, his á
girlfriend and their child for dinner. When I said to my á
brother's girlfriend that I would like them to come at my place á
for dinner, she refused and never mentioned it again as if I á
had never asked her.

Several years ago my brother died in an accident. When I heard á
about it, I was very sad. It took years until I resigned myself á
to it.

I read a book about the situation in South-Africa, about the á
terrible violations of human rights. I was disgusted with the á
white population.

My P.T. instructor also works as a masseur. He wanted to massage á
me, therefore I had to undress. For the first few times this was á
not easy for me; I got gradually used to it.

Some time ago I took the driving test. I did answer the á
theoretical questions very well, but I failed the practical á
driving test. It was my fault because I had not enough practice.

When my brother came back home after staying in hospital. He had á
undergone an operation which had been a matter of life or death. á
When he came home I could see him smile for the first time after á
may weeks.

After a short stay in Marocco we missed the ferry-boat back to á
Spain and we had to look for an accomodation. By chance we met a á
man who offered to take us to a camping site. While I was sitting in his á
car I was terribly afraid because I had heard of people being á
robbed in Marocco.

After an exhausting day I came home and wanted to take a bath to á
relax. My father wanted to take a bath first and when he had á
finished after an hour, there was no hot water left for me.

I met some nice people during my holdidays. When they left I knew á
that I would never see them again.

A drunk man attacked his wife and wanted to humiliate her by á
insulting her. Then he turned violent and started to beat her in á
front of her child. She left it happen without saying a word in á
order not to make things worse. I watched the scene and tried to á
calm the man, but without success. Just because he was stronger á
we had to comply. From that day I detested him.

For a medical check-up, we - boys and girls - had to take off our á
clothes with the exception of our underwear. Then we had to go á
into another classroom where older pupils were sitting and á
staring at us.

I allowed my little brother to clean the bathroom in his own way. á
My mother came and saw the floor overflowed with water, slapped á
my brother in the face and told him to go to bed immediately.

One day I did not feel very well and I wanted to talk to á
somebody. A friend invited me for dinner and I was very glad.

I was driving my car and it was very misty. It was in the night á
and I was alone in my car. I felt totally insecure, nervous and á
overstrained.

My mother treated me unjustly as if I was a little child. I said á
mean things. I was unable to defend myself adequately.

When my uncle died whom I had loved very much. I was very sad and á
I felt totally helpless.

I watched the news at the TV, it was a commentary about á
"Hainburg". I felt disgusted when I heard members of the union á
speak about the situation.

I took the tram without paying. There were many people around me á
when I was caught by a controller. I felt ashamed but also angry.

I behaved in a nasty manner towards a friend, I said things which á
I could have said in a more friendly way. After that I felt á
guilty.

A friend of mine often had difficulties with her parents. Once á
she had a child she had a better relationship with them.

Once our school class went skiing. On a steep slope a boy á
standing behind me lost his balance, fell down and drew me with á
him. I slided down the whole slope. At about 1 m distance from a á
tree I could stop.

It happened in a tram: some older people started to grumble about á
the young people just because I had not immediately left my seat á
to them.

When I was younger I was very good in apparatus gymnastics. I á
always won in competitions, but once I was only at the fourth á
place.
A friend was assaulted by a young man on her way home.
Some men were talking about me and my sister.

During my holidays I had a boyfriend who turned away from me á
outwardly. Therefore I danced with another man and raised certain á
hopes in him. After a while I had to explain to him the á
circumstances

I received a letter and a Christmas present from a person I had á
not seen for two years.

I was at home alone and my mother had asked me to heat the house. á
I put too much fuel into the stove. It began to glow and there á
was a noise in the whole house as if it was going to explode.

At the end of my holiday job I got less money than was due to me á
and nobody mentioned anything about that.

My little cat which I had raised all by myself, hanged itself when á
playing in the garden.

At school a classmate who was a very good pupil had to help á
another boy who performed less well. He told him on purpose the á
wrong things so that he had to repeat a year.

When I was a child I played my mother a nasty trick to make her á
feel hurt.

I had promised my friend to take her to an important appontment á
but I was late. So she missed the opportunity to get a wellpayed á
holiday job.

I have a boyfriend and I am very fond of him. When we had our á
"11-months jubilee", I had forgotten it. But he gave me a red á
rose.

When I was a child I was afraid of big dogs. One day when I came á
home a big dog was laying in front of our door. I was so á
frightened that I did not dare to enter the door and I waited á
until somebody passed by.

I share my small flat with my friend. On her birthday we could á
not see each other until evening because we had to stay at the á
University all day. In the evening I left a lecture before it á
finished to be able to buy flowers for her. When I was at home á
she called me to tell me that she would stay the night with her á
boyfriend.

When I was a child I had a grass-parakeet I liked very much. His á
legs were crippled so that he could not move very fast. Once I á
came into the room, did not notice him and stepped on him. A few á
days later he died.

When I was younger I often saw my father come home drunk (he had á
big problems at that time). Once he woke me up in the middle of á
the night and shouted at me.

At school I was bad in mathematics. Although my teacher had á
admonished me to do my homework, one day I had forgotten to do á
it. When my teacher noticed it, I blushed and was ashamed to be á
rebuked in front of the other pupils.á

When I was a child I often quarrelled with my younger sister. á
Once I became so angry that I slapped her in the face. She cried á
and shouted so that my mother came in and scolded me.

After a weekend at a seminar I saw my husband again. I hurried á
home hoping he would be there. We embraced - I enjoyed feeling á
his body.

One evening I stayed at home all alone. As we lived on the ground á
floor, I was often afraid of burglers.

One day, when riding on a bicycle path, a car coming from the á
opposite direction forced me to get off my bike although I had á
the priority.

My father died unexpectedly at the age of 53 years. He certainly á
would have liked to live longer. I was also said because I was á
confronted with the fact that I would die one day too.

One day, when I was twelve years old, my brother took some slimy á
substance swimming on the surface of a pot of vinegar made of á
cider and threatened to throw it at me.

When I was ten years old a classmate laughed at me because I had á
told him that my father had retired.

I felt guilty because I had not accomplished a thing as well as I á
had wanted to.
A party with friends on New Year's Eve.

When I was hitch-hiking and I went with a man who drived like a á
madman.

I was in "Hainburg" in December and I was angry about the á
politicians and the police.

I met again a very good friend after a year and realized that á
there had grown a certain distance between us.

When I listened to a conversation of friends talking about the á
power of money.
When my grandmother died - at her funeral.

I read about a monk who had been murdered and put into a barrel á
which was filled with blood of pigs.

I went for a walk with a very close friend; we were talking about á
our problems, I told her lies.

I had to tell a collegue the time for an appointment with another á
collegue. I told her the wrong time - it was obviously my fault.

I went to buy a bicycle with my father. When I wanted to pay, my á
father took his purse and payed.

My mother had fallen down from a ladder when she had been á
gathering cherries. Her back was hurt. Just when I arrived, I saw á
people of the life-saving service giving her medical care.

I was waiting behind a car which was going to leave the parking á
place, because I wanted to park my car there. Because of uncoming á
traffic I had to wait for a short time - another driver placed á
his car on the place.
My partner left me after we had been together for a long time.

At a discussion a friend took a "faschistic view", what I had not á
expected.

At a weekend's seminar my trousers suddenly burst, therefore I was á
prevented from participating in several activities.

When I was driving my motorbike I went into a bend incautiously á
and fell down. I was slightly hurt, the motorbike was slightly á
damaged.

Before Christmas I got to know a girl but our relationshop could á
not consolidate before the holiday. Therefore it was a big á
surprise to get a carefully hand-made present from her. - Our á
relationship grew closer.

When I was a child, I fell into a cellar (when playing) and could á
be freed only with big difficulties.

I was angry about several drivers who showed an aggressive and á
dangerous driving habit.

When my grandmother died. I had a very deep relation to her (I á
lived with her for several years).

Some time ago a girl tried to make me up without any action of my á
part. She used all possible means. Although I behaved refusingly á
she did not give up for a longer time.

When I went to the sauna for the first time and there were men á
and women.

When I was parking my car I was not cautious and bumped into á
another car. I caused considerable damage. The driver of the á
other car was very angry and I let him insult me because I felt á
guilty.

A person whom I had not seen for a long time called me and á
invited me for a party.

When I was walking on the street, a group of drunk, bawling young á
people approached.

When I was house-hunting: Another person got a flat that I would á
have liked, too, because he heaped a floot of words on the á
letter.
When my grandmother died.

When I shoplifted a pair of earrings from Coles and my Mum caught á
me with them in my bag.

When my mother was tremendous on the phone and we talked for á
hours. She was in a good mood.

When I saw a good male friend unexpectedly after a year, as I've á
just returned from overseas. I was feeling tired, looking a mess, á
and nervous.

When I wanted to talk to someone I liked and whom I have been á
told likes me (by his brother and even by himself) however he á
avoids any confrontation, and is vague.

After having left the company of someone who gave me a lot of á
support and made me laugh, found myself alone for days on end.

When a boy had continued to use foul language and swearing in á
front of a group of my friends.

When I was about seven or eight I was caught having stolen a á
doll's dress from my next-door neighbour.

Feeling guilt after greed, buying chocolate and pigging out to á
the point of feeling sick, especially as I am fat.
When planning to marry.

No really strong such emotion. Just falling off to sleep when I á
caught sight of a 5 cm diameter spider crawling onto the pillow á
beside me.

My feelings towards would-be in-laws for their participation in á
recent broken relationship.

Recent break-up of seriors long-term relationship, helped along á
by would-be  in-laws.

No very strong such emotion. Treatment of my sister by her á
dancing instructor - he is a "user", i.e., takes advantage of her á
good nature.

After failing a second attempt at Med 4, following a number of á
difficult personal circumstances.

Failure to complete medical course as a result of failing fourth á
year twice.

When Wayne and Sue (close friends) were announced our guardians á
at ther wedding.

Car accident nearly occurred between us and drunk driver coming á
in opposite direction it missed us by approx 1 m and collided á
(after rolling twice midair) into nearby scrub.
When boyfriend lied to me.
When my boyfriend took me to his father's grave.

On boat trip - saw mother giving young child (aprox 6-7 years) á
cigarettes.
When harassed by this boy - it was sexual (refer to GUILT).

When in grade 3, late home from school every day for weeks á
because of harassment from a grade 7 boy I lied to mother about á
why I was home late.
Getting a part-time job.

Small car accident. Black ice on the road - cars in front of us á
started zig-zagging and so did we. Car in front did a 180¦ turn we á
followed and ended up in a gully.
People hunting animals.

When my grandfather was sick, and died I felt more sad, though, á
when he was sick.
People spitting in railway stations.
Falling over.

Eating too much I felt guilty afterwards because I knew I á
shouldn't have overeaten as I'm putting on too much weight.

When my last year's second semester results came through - I was á
ecstatic.

I was sleeping in my room but woke in the middle of the night to á
think I could hear noises and see shadows moving. I felt that á
someone was in the house.

At school, a couple of years ago, a so-called acquaintance told lies á
about me to a teacher I was told about it by friends who overheard á
the conversation.

My grandfather died. He lived almost as a recluse not caring for á
himself as well as he should - Dad and we all helped as much as á
we could, but it didn't save him from himself. It was an á
unexpected death. His second de facto wife was lucky she wasn't á
jailed.

In my penultimate job I was responsible of a sections with á
several employers, after several years of dedication I was á
dismissed by a new chef, saying that I was incompetent.

I assisted to a scene where the police attacked a person that á
didn't have his documents. The savagery was too much, and the á
attacked person bleeded to much.
In a party of friends I got completely drunk.

Once in my homes yard, I was plaing football with my cousin and á
in a certain quick the ball went on uncontrolled putting down a á
bird-cage, killing it.

When I get something that seemed very hard like getting a job, a á
boyfriend, etc. A specific sutuations, was when I started to date á
a boy whom I liked for a long time.
When I had to assume a position which I didn't expect.

When I was dismissed unjustly from the firm where I worked, á
because there where persons that didn't have problems, and á
wouldn't miss in the jobs they occupied if they were dismissed.

I felt very sad when I had to give up something that by right was á
mine and although I didn't get it, a kind of suvenir that people á
don't give you the right to have.

The acts of brutal violence in generally disgusts me. Fights, á
phisical aggrssion, etc.

I felt ashamed when in a certain occasion I had to read a text á
and didn't stop stuttering.
When I was reproved eighth grade of high school.

When I talked with a teacher yesterday who, to say the least, was á
rude and unwise and had irrelevant opinions about a friend.
The loss of the woman who loved me most till today.

In a sexual experience with an unknown woman where after the á
sexual act I only could go away without looking backwards.
When I wanted to kiss a friend and didn't succeed, I felt shame.

On a telephone talk where I was agressive and stupid without the á
least, reason or better motive.

When I succeed in writing something I felt and doing it I felt á
well and very happy for being able to express to myself something á
that was suffocating me.
When I crashed my car.

When in a difficult moment I couldn't express myself correctly á
and my thought came out with distortions bringing about highly á
negative and distorted results.

When I heard about the death of somebody I liked very much and I á
was not present either to see the person or to try to share my á
emotions with other friends.

When I saw a woman subjugated by money and not being able to hide á
how she hated herself for not having the will power to get out of á
such a situation because it was convenient, according to what she á
told me.

When somebody suddenly said something (about me) at a wrong á
moment and I didn't agree (at that exact moment I was needing an á
extremely positive word).
When my mother surprised me while masturbating.

I forgot to water the flowers in our flat and was rebuked by my á
friends who share the flat with me.

After my final examination at school I was glad that the á
examination was over and that I had passed it.

When I was a child, I had a nightmare. At that time, I was not á
yet able to tell anybody about it, so I was very frightened. I á
could not explain myself all that and I had to deal with it by á
myself.

I was angry with a person who behaved terribly at a ball á
offending her relatives.

When my grandfather died. When I heard about his death, I had a á
bad feeling in my stomach and I felt as if I had lost something á
very precious.
My brother caught a spider and let his frog eat it.

Once I spoke without thinking very much - it was quite a á
nonsense.

I was not sure whether I should help an old woman going down a á
flight of stairs. I just watched her and saw how difficult it was á
for her to do it.

For about one year I had a rather bad relation with my father. á
Last Christmas Eve he invited me to stay withhim and I was very á
glad about it. It was a fine evening.

I live outside Graz - so I have to go by bus. One day I went home á
from the bus stop alone. It was dark, I had to go through a á
forest and there was a dark figure behind me. I was very á
frightened.

My sister had promised to help me to do a translation from á
English into German. But the day I needed her she told me that á
she was busy - I was very angry.

Several years ago my mother died. She had been ill for a long á
time, but nevertheless her death came unexpectedly. I did not and á
I still do not want to believe that it is true.

I have a horror of spiders and snakes. On a walk through the wood á
I saw the body of a slow-worm (without the head).

I came home from a party rather drunk. I said things I would á
never have said normally. Next morning I was terribly ashamed á
about what I had said.

An accident happened to my little cousin because I had not taken á
enough care of her. She fell on the floor and her hands were á
hurt.

I had a little cat which was very sick. As I liked it very much I á
went to a veterinary with it. He told me how to tend it and it á
really recovered its health. Everybody said that I had saved its á
life.

When I was a child, I had a terrible nightmare with St. Nicholas' á
Devil Servant. I asked my mother if he really existed and she á
said yes. The following nights I could not sleep and a á
light had to be left turned on.

As I usually do not start learning until a short time before an á
examination,, I once made up my mind to try to work for a longer á
time. But once again I did not do it - and got a bad mark.

A friend told me about his cousin who is my girlfriend. He said á
she had treated him in a mean and nasty way. I was surprised á
because in front of other people she had always treated him in a á
friendly way. I am very sad about it.

I went out with my sister, her boyfriend and his friend. I did á
not like this young man. But suddenly he overcame me and kissed á
me. He was very strong so that I could not defend myself.

During the oral part of my final examination I made a mistake in á
speaking so that all the teachers laughed at me.

There was a time when I did not get on well with my sister. I á
always grumbled at her and said bad things about her to my á
mother. So my mother always scolded her.
When I passed my final examination at school.

When I was on a cave excursion with friends, I suddenly lost them á
and was afraid of losing my way in the cave.
When I felt being treated unjustly by a teacher.

When my grandmother died; I had a stronger relation to her than á
to my mother.
When I was molested by an old drunk man.
When I had a Latin examination in school.
When I had drunk too much and nearly got an alcohol poisoning.

When I met my girlfriend again in another town after a long á
separation.

When I went home alone early in the morning, I had to go through á
a wood.

A friend was unpunctual, we wanted to prepare ourselves for an á
examination.
When my grandparents moved to another part of the town.

At the butcher's I saw an animal which had just been slaughtered; á
blood was dripping on the floor.

In school I was very bad in running long distances and my á
class-mates laughed at me for this reason.

I had to take care of my little brother. When I met a friend I á
did not pay attention to him for a certain time and he was hurt á
while he was playing.

On my birthday, an old friend of mine sent me a card. I had not á
met him for a year and I was very glad that he had thought of me.

Once I spent a night with a friend at the secondary school. We á
told each other horror stories and suddenly we heard uncanny á
noises. I was terribly frightened.

When we still attended school, my brother and I usually went to á
see our aunt and to show her our term's report. She rewarded us á
with money. Although my reports were as good as my brother's, he á
got more money.

My friend was pregnant, but lost her child during the second á
month. I went to see her at hospital - she was crying. I felt á
very sorry for her.

When I attended school, our class visited an institution for á
mentally and physically handicapped persons. Although I tried to á
control my feelings, I was disgusted.

After a party I spent the night with a friend. We both were á
drunk, the morning was disillusioning. A friend was me leaving á
the room and I felt shabby and immoral.

I had to take care of a neighbour's child. I did not look after á
it all the time and the child fell down and was hurt. I felt á
guilty.

A very good friend of mine had been away for three months. When á
we met again, we ran up to each other and embraced.

One evening my father told me to go into the cellar and get him a á
beer. I was terribly frightened at the idea of a man sitting in á
the cellar and assaulting me. For my defence I took an empty á
bottle with me.

I had stolen a bottle of rum from a person who knows me well. He á
threatened to call the police if I did not pay 500 Shillings.

When my uncle died I saw a funeral for the first time. All people á
stood around the open grave and cried.

At a party I met a girl who drew me to her, told me some nonsense á
and always wanted to kiss me.

I put my head into the pullover of a girl to see her breasts. The á
girl looked at me so that I felt ashamed.

My uncle had promised to buy me a bicycle. As time went by and I á
had not received it yet, I asked my father to buy it for me. á
Later I heard that my uncle had wanted to offer me the bicycle on á
my birthday two weeks later.

Several days after my final examination at school, I was sitting á
in an airplane on my way to Greece. I enjoyed that moment very á
much.

One night I was lying in my bed awake but I had my eyes closed. I á
saw figures with terrible faces and black frocks bending over me á
and touching me. I opened my eyes but I could still see them. I á
had the feeling that somebody was in the room. It was terrible. á
Only when I turned on the light I was able to go to sleep.

I had arranged with a friend to go with him to Carinthia by car. á
We had arranged a place where to meet. I was a bit late and my á
friend had left already. I had no money to go by train. I nearly á
started to cry because I was so angry - it was very important for á
me to go to Carinthia.

Our dog had to be shot because he had killed a roe. I liked him á
very much and so I could not resign myself to that. I hated the á
hunter who shot him.

I was sitting in a station-hall and watching a lavatory á
attendant. She was very dirty. She started to eat something out á
of a dirty cup - it must have been something like lard. Then she á
took some breadcrumbs out of the pockets of her apron and ate á
them. I had to leave - I felt like vomitting.

I had to go to the doctor's because of a veneral disease. I told á
the doctor that I must have been infected by my boy-friend. This á
was not true, but I was ashamed to tell the truth.

When we were playing, I hurt my little sister, but towards my á
mother I did not admit that it was my fault.

My neighbour was not able to set his car in motion because it had á
snowed heavily. I helped him - he was thankful and invited me.

I was skiing with friends and they wanted to ski-jump. I did not á
want to be left behind, so I braced myself and followed them.

At an examination I got a bad mark just because of a small á
mistake. When I went to the lector and wanted to talk about that, á
he did not listen to me but sent me away.

My cut was run over by a car. After searching for a long time I á
found her lying in a kerb. I was rather shocked and angry with á
the driver.

When I watched a report about El Salvador on TV, I saw people who á
had been murdered by terrible methods.

At a cross-country race I wanted to take a short-cut (which is á
not allowed). I was caught and disqualified. All my friends had á
observed that.

During a discussion I reacted very aggressively and so I made it á
impossible to continue discussing.

On my birthday I got a present that I had desired for a long á
time.

When I am discussing something with a person and I realize that á
the other person is thinking over her own argumentations instead á
of listening, I become angry.

When we were on holidays my girl-friend had to leave me after 4 á
weeks and I had to stay in Turkey for some more weeks because I á
had a job there.

I studied medicine for several semesters. I was always disgusted á
when we had the dissecting-course. I cannot understand why some á
persons like this course.

Some time ago we had a tournament in our tennis-club. For á
tactical reasons I was chosen to play against a much weaker á
player than I am. Although it would have been enough simply to á
win the game, I defeated him extremely. This would not have been á
necessary.

I had a discussion with my girl-friend. After some time we á
started to quarrel and at least - to get the upper hand - I said á
that she was not as important to me as she might believe. Some á
time later I apologized for that.

On New Year's Eve I went in a disco with friends. I amused myself á
and got to know many other people.

I had to go to the dentist's. When he touched my tooth with his á
drill, I was terribly aftaid of the pain I would feel any moment.

I was very hungry and just wanted to start eating when a friend á
called me who usually talks for a long time. I was angry because á
I was prevented from eating.

My sister, whom I like very much, asked me for a favour which I á
refused her for some flimsy reason. Some time later I felt sorry á
for that and something like sadness.

On my way to a concert I went with a man who tried to molest me. á
At that moment I did not care much but now the impression fills á
me with disgust.

I asked my friend to come with me to a disco because I wanted to á
be with a person I know well. But when I amused myself with á
others I let my friend sit alone, although I had asked her to á
come.

I called my little sister to make her pick up her toy from the á
floor. When she still refused after I had asked her for the á
fourth time, we began to quarrel. At last the whole family was á
involved in this quarrel and trouble was brewing.

I had a singing-lesson, but I was not very good. The last á
exercise was singing scales. I did that very well and my teacher á
seemed satisfied.

A teacher wanted to instill a certain opinion and a certain á
behaviour into myself, what I refused. I was afraid when I saw á
him.

A friend had promised to call me at a certain time. I expected á
his call impatiently but in vain.

Years ago on Christmas Eve I felt very sad because I realized for á
the first time how I missed my father who had died at Christmas á
Years ago.
A man whom I like, was drunk and tried to molest me.

It was the time when everybody spoke about and discussed á
Hainburg. I was also asked for my opinion. I was ashamed because á
I had no firm view of the whole thing and therefor was not able á
to join the conversation.

I was on a concert-tour and therefor seperated from my á
boy-friend. But I needed warmth which was given by a male member á
of the orchestra. My feelings towards him were not very deep, but á
his feelings were. I felt guilty when he said "I am not a á
radiator".

On my 18th birthday I passed the driving-test. I was glad because á
I had had to study very much, because I had been lucky and á
because - as a proof that it was really difficult - not everybody á
had passed the test.

At about midnight I had to go by bike through Graz alone. On the á
whole it was a distance of several kilometers. A car followed me á
through the streets. Only when I went into a one-way street the á
car disappeared. The rest of my way home I was very afraid.

I had studied for almost one week for my physics-examination. á
With difficulty I passed the examn. I was angry about the teacher á
and also about myself because I had not remembered enough during á
the examn and because the time that I spent studying was wasted.

I had cared for a horse for 2 years. One day it was sold and I á
cried for several days because I was so sad.

A friend of mine was telling jokes which I felt to be very á
disgusting, especially because I was eating.

At a carneval-party I smooched with a man - some days later I was á
rather ashamed for that.

By fun I had a tussle with my sister. Suddenly I obviously hurt á
her unintentionally - and she ran out of the room, crying.

During my first week in Graz I met a girl who I had got to know á
in the train from Amsterdam to Graz. Although I had considered á
her very sympathetic, we had seperated without changing our á
adresses.

Many years ago I saw the film "Psycho" by Hitchcock for the first á
time. When I saw the film I was alone and afterwards I hardly á
dared to go to bed and hardly was able to sleep.

I had got a bad cold. My father said I must be crazy to go by á
motorbike at those temperatures. When I answered him that I did á
not care about a cold, he said that if I did not care for á
anything I could leave him (it was for the second time he said á
something like that).

I was at home alone when I realized that a young roe approached á
our house. I hid because I did not want to frighten it. It á
limped. Some time later, when I thought that it had already run á
away, I saw it lying on our terrace. I came nearer and saw that á
it was terribly wounded. I informed the ranger who said that the á
roe must have been attacked by dogs. He had to shoot it.

Several years ago I stayed with friends in the mountains for one á
week. We lived in a hut and had to cook for ourselves. One day my á
friend did not succeed in preparing spaghetti. That dinner was á
terrible - nevertheless we all ate rather much and had an á
improper and unsavoury conversation.

My mother and my grandmother were talking about one of my á
grandmother's friends whom I hardly know. I gave some deprecatory á
comments on him whereupon my grandmother told me that the man had á
died recently.

When I still went to primary-school, I went on a ski-trip with my á
family. After skiing we went to a restaurant for lunch. Suddenly á
my father said that he had forgotten something in the car. He á
gave me the key and asked me to go and get it. I had difficulties á
with the key which was already bent. I asked my mother to help á
me. When she tried to turn the key it broke. We had no second á
key. My mother was blamed for all that and I did not say a word.

I had not studied very much for my final examination at school, á
so I had to take an additional examination in French. The oral á
examination was not very hard for me - the more I was glad when I á
heard that I had passed it.

When I was 8 years old my tonsils had to be operated on. This is á
not a complicated operation, but just before it started I was á
very afraid so that I will never forget it.

My parents are divorced, father pays alimony for me. Two years á
ago my sister who lives with father, suddenly asked mother for á
money. As she considered the amount of money my mother offered á
her too small, she brought an action against mother. I was á
terribly angry with my sister.

I arranged with a friend to go skating the next day. He asked me á
to wake him up by telephone at twelve o'clock because we had come á
home late in the morning. Next day I called him - he was not at á
home. As something like that had happened to me several times á
before, I came to the conclusion that one cannot rely on anybody á
and I felt very sad.
Whenever I see a spider or a snake I feel disgusted.

When I had slept with a boy for the first time I felt ashamed for á
three reasons. First, because I was only 13 years old, second, á
because I did not really like him, third, because he had caught á
me napping.

I had been together with my boy-friend for two and a half years, á
when he got to know another girl and not even tried to conceal á
that from me. I drew my conclusions and left him - I also felt a á
bit guilty for what had happened.

My boy-friend told me that he would take me to the training of á
the life-saving dogs.

I was in a dark cellar and saw a glowing red point. I thought á
that it was a person with a cigarette - but it was only the red á
switch.

A man treated his dog very badly - he insulted and beated him á
until the dog kept lying on the floor with his tail drawn in.
A horse which I had liked very much was taken away.

On TV I saw a report about church in Amerika. A priest was shown á
who was performing miracles in front of the camera - I felt á
disgusted.

When I was a child, my uncle came to see us. I spit at him and á
ran out - I do not know the reason for that. My father came after á
me and insisted on my apologizing.

I quarreled with my boy-friend. He said it was unfair that I á
always started crying so that he had to give in.

To be able to prepare myself better for an important examination, á
I did not spend the nitht with my girl-friend but in the á
students' hostel. I had not done that for months. The day when I á
had the examn, somebody knocked at my door at seven o'clock in á
the morning. My girl-friend who likes sleeping late, had come to á
be able to be with me.

I studied medicine for several semesters and at that time I á
developed a great fear of examinations. I was most afraid of my á
examination of anatomy. While other students were examined, I was á
dissecting. I was able to hear everything and was waiting with á
fear until it was my turn.

When I come home in the evening, the first thing I do is to sit á
down and smoke a cigarette. One day I found the flat in a totally á
desolate state. My girl-friend had wanted to tidy up but had not á
finished.

My son's mother told me that she wanted to move to Vienna and á
take the child with her. This means a rather long distance for á
me. My whole family was sad and dumbfounded so that my own á
feelings were intensified.

When a very near person got into an awkward situation but showed á
only helplessness and indecision.

I spent an evening with my girl-friend. When we wanted to go to á
bed I was totally drunk. Next morning I felt rather ashamed.

I threw away an object, which belonged to a friend, because I did á
not know what to do with it. My friend was very sad about that á
and I felt guilty.
After a long time I saw my boy-friend again.
My first public appearance in front of a rathe big audience.

I was angry about how the government acted concerning Hainburg, á
especially when I saw a discussion about it on TV.
Death of my father; he died of laryngeal cancer.
When I got indecent offers.

When I bought new skis; I was ashamed to tell the assistant that á
I am not good at skiing and therefor bought racing skis.

My schoolmates were teasing a pupil who was not able to defend á
himself very well; I should have taken his part.

I thought that I had failed an examination, but when I was á
informed about the mark, I saw that I had passed it.

Before an examination: I had the fealing that I had not learned á
enough.

Once when I was playing table tennis I was already sure that I á
would win , but at last I lost the game.
My grandfather's funeral.

In cinema I saw a film which showed how a person was torn out his á
guts when he was still alive.

I was sitting in a restaurant with friends. They asked me á
something which they thought I should know. Actually I know it, á
but at that time I was not able to remember it.

I had an appointment with a friend. I promised him to meet with á
him, but at last I did not without having informed him.

When I had a psychical crisis, I met a girl, who told me that she á
had had almost the same problems and how she had finally overcome á
them.

I had climbed on a cherry tree alone and there was a thick á
caterpillar beside my fingers. I feel disgusted by caterpillars á
and snakes. I was terribly afraid of the caterpillar crawling on á
my fingers. Out of the fear I was almost unable to climb down.

A friend of mine told other people that I was a slattern (because á
of an occurence that had happened some time ago). When I heard á
about that I was very angry.

My grandfather was seriously ill, he had only a few days left to á
live. I had always loved him, but never told him. When I saw him á
for the last time, I had the feeling that I had omitted so many á
things I could not do again. - There was a fly sitting on his á
forehead and he was too weak to drive it away. I was very sad á
when I saw that.

Normally my father never tells vulgar jokes, we do not speak á
about sexual things, too. But once he told such a vulgar joke, á
that I was really disgusted. He did not tell me, but some of his á
friends, but I was present.

When I was 6 or 7 years old, I pulled down the trousers of a á
friend because I wanted to know what she looked like. My mother á
watched that and (as a punishment) sent me into the house. We á
never spoke about that; I think it was as embarassing for her as á
it was for me.

When I told my boy-friend, who loved me very much, that I wanted á
to put an end to our relationship. a long time before I told him á
that and also a long time after that I felt guilty, because I had á
hurt him so much.

Unexpectedly I met some persons who I like very much. á
Spontaneously they invited me and integrated me within their á
group, although it was late in the evening.

After a footballmatch I went home by car, a friend drove. I did á
not realize that he was drunk until we were in the car. He was á
madly racing. Several times we were in dangerous situations and I á
told him to be cautious, but he did not care.

A friend of mine uses butter instead of oil when he is cooking. I á
am always angry about that, because it is an unnecessary luxury. á
Recently we both were cooking and he wanted to use butter again. á
When I had already put the oil into the pan, he poured it out á
again and put the butter into the pan.

After some friends had come to see me. They had stayed for á
several days and we had got on very well. When they had left, I á
had a feeling of emptyness.

I had a quarrel with a friend who lived with me in the same flat. á
He moved out. Before he went he invited me and some friends for a á
drink. At last he was totally drunk and smelled disgusting. á
Besides, he told lies about us and behaved as if he was to be á
pitied.

I went to see a friend. There were other people, too, and á
everybody brought some present. I was the onlyone who brought á
nothing. My friend was very hospitable and did not show anything á
- although I knew how he felt.

With a group of handicapped people we went to a party. When we á
wanted to leave we were not able to find one of these people. I á
had told his mother that we would leave at 4.30 p.m., actually it á
was planned for 3.30 p.m. Therefore there was a delay.

I had a quarrel with my fiancT. When he admitted his fault, á
everything was allright. It was then for the first time that he á
surprised me with coffee and cake and a bunch of flowers.

After my boy-friend had beaten me for the first time, I always á
trembled when somebody knocked on my door or when I heard steps á
coming nearer.

I had not eaten anything for 2 days to be able to pay the fine á
for my fiancT. But he stayed in another town and spent one á
thousand shillings in the restaurant during the same time.
I had to give up my love, because it did not work out well.
I was insulted without a reason by a drunk man.

My boyfriend had drunk too much and beaten me. When I had to show á
the letter the door, which was almost crashed, I felt ashamed.

I spied on my fiancT and was terribly jealous. Later I saw that á
there was no reason for that.

My sister had a daughter. I saw the baby for the first time á
through a pane of glass and she looked at me.

My mother, my sister and I were sitting in the sitting room and á
watching a film on TV. My father came home drunk and told us to á
turn off. When we did not do that he switched off the fuse and á
started shouting. We were sitting in the dark and I was afraid á
that he would do us a harm.

I bought an aquarium which made me much pleasure. I was watching á
the fish when my father came in and asked me how much I had payed á
for it. He said he would not pay for the current that it would á
require.

When I was 9 years old, I got a cat, but after 3 days he died. I á
was very sad, because I had nursed him and taken him to the á
veterinary's - but in vain. Although I had had him only for a á
short time I had liked him very much.

When my grandmother was about 80 years old, she lived with us for á
several years. I saw her illness. I did not even want to breath á
the air that smelled of her presence.

I am left-handed. When I attended the first form, we learned to á
write with pens. I smeared everything I had written. All my á
friends had written well and wanted to know why the teacher was á
looking at my note-book. I was ashamed.

When I was 4, we spent our holidays at the seaside. My sister and á
her friend wanted to go to a bay on an undangerous way. I wanted á
to arrive before them and went on a shorter, but more dangerous á
way. When I arrived, I found nobody there. I waited for a long á
time, but nobody came. On my way back I met my mother who had á
been searching for me desperatly. She did not scold me, but I saw á
how much she had worried (herself).

When I was 17, I had a mystic vision. I melted into a dazzling á
light, which omitted perfect love. The physical experience became á
unimportant, I heard or saw the words "overcome egotism". The á
feeling of joy remained for month after that experience.

When we had swimming instruction, we had to take a header from á
the springboard. I usually refused to do that, but at least I was á
forced to.

When I played in a chess championship, I was disturbed by other á
people. I asked them to be quiet, but in vain.
When my flute-teacher was replaced by a new one.

When I was a child, I was sometimes forced to eat things that á
disgusted me.

When I was 12 years old, some friends of our family had come to á
watch TV. I lay on the floor and moved my pelvis. When the other á
people had gone, my mother told me that it had looked as if I had á
wanted to make sex.

When I shirked the gymnastic lesson I met the director of our á
school who asked me what I was doing.

When I was in a situation which seemed hopeless for me, I moved á
back to my parents. For my father it went without saying anything á
(normally he ofter grumbles at me).

I lived in a flat with a couple. The woman was so jealous of me, á
that she sometimes had crying fits. Eventually her husband could á
not stand that any more and wanted to kill me.

I have a very big family. At my grandmother's funeral we all met á
and everybody pretended mourning. In reality it was like a á
fashion-show: everybody wanted to show himself.
Often a dog which is treated very badly by his owner comes to us.

After a pleasant evening with friends in my flat, one of them did á
not want to leave, because he wanted to sleep with me. He said á
that he had fallen in love with me, that he felt alone and so on.

I look up to my Karate-teacher. When I came to a training lesson á
after I had not trained for one week, I was totally stiff. I was á
ashamed.

My sisters asked me to fetch them at a discotheque which is 5 km á
off. There was a thick fog and snowfall. There was not enough á
room in the car for all of them and they asked me to go there á
once again. When I did not do that they had a way to make me feel á
guilty.

When I heard that I had passed my final examination at school á
(with success).
Before my final examination.
When my mother kept me in leading-strings.
When my father died.
When I worked at the life-saving sevice and saw the first exitus.
When I made a fool at an examination.

When I had wrongly explained someone an important exemple for an á
examination.

Last year I went to see friends in Yugoslavia - two girls with á
whom I get along very well.

Before I went to the urologist's I was afraid for several á
reasons: because it was for the first time, because the medical á
check-up might be painful, because of the uncertainty and because á
someone had informed me about it.

My girl-friend did not understand me; I was angry with myself á
because I had problems when we seperated - I could not resign á
myself to it.
A friend who was 22 years old died.

When I was in the army, we got a certain dish for dinner that I á
do not like at all. We were not obliged to eat, but I was very á
hungry.
I had to pay a fine because of speeding.

A friend who was 22 years old, died of leukemia; I had not known á
that he was so ill and therefore had not cared.
When we got a young dog.
I was afraid before I went to the doctor's.
I had an accident with damage to the car body.
My dog died of a cerebral tumor.

When I worked at the life-saving service I was disgusted by a á
patient whose outward appearance was distasteful.

When I was a child, I had a medical check-up. I had to undress á
myself and was examined by several doctors.

When a classmate wanted to sit down, I pulled his chair away, so á
that he was slightly injured.

When I heard that a good friend, who had been abroad for a long á
time, would come and see me.

When I had my first oral examination after a long time; á
especially one day before the examination when I had the feeling á
that I had not studied enough and had not enough time to make up á
for it.

I heard friends grumbling at me in an adjoining room, although á
they had behaved in a friendly way when I was present.
When my brother died.

I read about a murderer who brutalized his victims by cutting á
open their stomaches and taking out their bowels.

When I was a child: I had told my mother a lie and she found it á
out.

My father had been alone for a long time because my mother and á
sister were on holiday. I had not seen him for a long time and á
when I finally called him I realized that he had been very sad á
about that.
I unexpectedly got a present from my father.

When I had to go through lonely streets in the middle of the á
night.

My boy-friend had promised me to come home at about 10 p.m. He á
did not return until midnight and had consumed a lot of alcohol.
A relative, whom I like very much, left for the United States.

When I was walking on the street, I slipped on the dung of a dog. á
I did not fall down, but I felt disgusted by the bad smell on my á
sole.

Some persons, who are important for me, came to see me and I had á
not washed the dishes.

I was looking after my cousin's little daughter; she fell down, á
was slightly injured and cried vociferously.

I met again a very good friend whom I had not seen for a long á
time.

I got lost in a foreign town. I did not know the language of that á
country and it took me hours to meet my friends again.

A friend had promised to get me a book which was very important á
for my work, but she forgot it.

My dog, whom I had had for eleven years, died. I watched his á
soporification.

A drunk man bumped into me and wanted to grip me. Fortunately I á
was able to break loose.

When I stayed on a nudism beach, a man was watching me in a á
disagreeable way. I had the feeling that he was examining my á
body.

I had a quarrel with my father. He was depressed, because á
somebody had treated him injustly. As we had an argument, it was á
impossible for me to help him.

My friend came to see me after she had stayed abroad. I waited at á
the station.

After a motor accident (I was the frong-seat-passenger) I spit á
blood.

At an office an application that I had made was turned down á
because of a scrupulous interpretation of the rules.
My uncle died - I felt sad at the funeral.

I saw a drunk man tottering behind his wife and insulting her á
awfully.

After an oral examination I shook the professor's hand, but he á
had only stretched it out for my ball-point-pen.
I spread abroad an intimate secret.

I bought a Christmas present for my girl-friend. On my way home I á
was really glad about having found such a suitable thing.

My fear appeared in the form of jealousy. I was afraid that my á
girl-friend had fallen in love with another man, I was afraid to á
lose her.

I was angry when I watched a ski-race. All the Austrian skiers á
dropped out.

During my holiday I met again a friend who had tried to commit á
suicide. She had just left hospital, her lips were trembling, she á
looked miserable.

On my way home in the middle of the night I saw a drunk man and a á
woman who were quarreling, beating each other, shouting and so á
on. I felt disgusted especially because they treated each other á
in such a degrading way.

My girl-friend and I live in one flat with another couple. We get á
along very well and usually we share everything. Once we two were á
sitting in our room and eating a cake when the others came in.

I was on a visit to friends who have a baby. The baby was crying á
in another room, but soon it became quieter and it seemed that it á
would fall asleep. I went into the room where the baby was lying á
- and it started crying again.

I went to fetch my girl-friend at the station. When the train á
arrived and I saw her descending and running up to me, I felt á
glad.

When I wanted to go into a house, there was suddenly a big dog á
standing beside me. It was hardly moving, but I did not know how á
it would react later on.

My father had bought too many goods for his shop, there was not á
enough space to store them.
A friend died of cancer when he was 18 years old.

At a party I saw two persons having a fight. The aggressions and á
the hate between these persons produced an unpleasant impression á
on me.

During a discussion I said something rather stupid and á
unnecessary.

When I was driving my car, I wanted to pick something from the á
floor of the car and drove into the guide-rail. I thought that I á
should not have done that and felt guilty.

On my birthday a friend came to see me unexpectedly and brought á
me flowers. I usually do not see her very often.

I was awakened by a dream in the middle of the night. I dreamt á
that a stranger was in my house.

My boy-friend had promised me to come an 10 a.m. - he was 3 hours á
late.
When I heard about a murder of a 16-year-old girl.

When I broke the piggy bank of my brother and my mother á
discovered that.

I was sitting in a restaurant with friends and I knew that in the á
meantime my girl-friend must have come to my flat and found the á
door closed.

After I had been away for a long time a friend told me that I had á
passed all my written examinations.

Recently my younger brother disappeared for two days without á
leaving a trace. Usually he tells me when he wants to do á
something like that, therefore I was afraid that something had á
