and ridiculous attitude.

A great friend of mine travelled with the intention to change his á
life. He didn't succeed and returned depressed. I had not power á
to support his frustration and his behavioral change.

A friend of mine travelled very far. I miss her but feel joy too á
because fer life is taking the right direction as she wants. So I á
feel joy for her mainly.

Motorcyclistic accident where for some minutes I didn't know if I á
was alive or dead, I remained "cold levered" during the situation á
but felt great fear.

When I acted in a negative way at a certain moment by laziness á
to concede a moment of the time I thought to be my own.
When I met my mother after months of absence.
When I whatched a horror film on a Friday 13th.

Discussing with a certain person about a job I was getting and á
that perosn was negative and pessimistic.
When I felt lack of aid from close friends.

When I saw a fight I had a physical reaction of disgust and of á
deep perturbation.
Walking on the street passing by an air duct, my skirt went up.
Being disloyal with persons I loved.
I got a present from a great friend (a dog).

There was a scene of shooting in front of my house, I was very á
afraid. Two armed men confronting. I didn't discover the reason á
of the incident.

I was waiting to receive the participation on the profits and did á
not receive it.
I didn't get the job I wanted.

I went to eat at my aunt's house and she served macaroni with a á
horrible appearence. I felt the sensation above. The worst was á
that I was practically obliged to eat.

When I saw my father coming out of the bathroom. He thought that á
he was alone at home and came out without his clothes.

When I misled a person: I said that I would do her a á
favour and didn't.
When I can see my parents because now I am far from them.
When I sit for examinations.
Once, during a performance I did not sing the way I had to.
When I got separated from the woman I loved.
When the Americans set their nucleaar missiles in Europe.

When I don't say the truth, when I don't do a certain thing á
thanks to my laziness.
Once I promised to do something but I didn't do it.
When I was admitted to the Bulgarian State Conservatoire.
I am afraid if I'll finish the term.
I was angry when my abilities of a singer were underestimated.

I feel sadness from the fact that I was not born with a better á
appearance.

I was disgusted with the hypocrisy of my colleagues from the á
group.
Shame I feel when I am not properly dressed.

A sense of guilt I felt once when I couldn't defend the á
confidence my teacher had in me and thus discrediting him at a á
concert.
I have a new born child.
I could have been killed by a falling object.

At a certain situation I felt myself neglected and undeservedly á
harmed.
The sudden death of one of my parents.

Getting separated from my family for a week caused me a sense of á
sadness.

I felt it when I saw a colleague of mine eating like a beast. At á
the same time he was making gestures, speaking and making the á
hell of a noise.

I felt a sense of shame when I compromised a colleague of mine. I á
got an information from him which I quite out of place shared á
with another colleague of mine and it resulted in an unpleasant á
consequence for him.

I promised to fulfill an errand. Later I understood it was á
impracticable. The explanation I gave was accompanied by a sense á
of guilt.

I felt joy most strongly some years ago, when I took part in a á
NH Competition and I was the first.

I feel fear when I only imagine I could lose confidence in my own á
abilities and powers. A similar feeling I feel sometimes before á
an exam.

I feel anger when I see a "parent" beating and punishing his child á
in the street. Recently I was a withness of a similar case.

I feel sadness when I only imagine that I could lose a close á
person. Some time ago I lost a man whom aI greatly respected.

A similar feeling I felt quite recently while travelling in a á
taxi. The driver treated me roughly and dishonestly - he chose á
the longest route, he overdrawed almost one lev more and he tried á
to be intimate with me.

Some days ago I fell down at a public place, I came into notice á
but thank God I was not mocked at. Though it hurt badly, at the á
first moment I felt shame, not ache.

I felt guilty because of the pain I caused to a very close á
friend. But over the feeling of guilt, my conviction of being á
right dominated.
When my nephew was born. The birth was hard, it was a big baby.

Late one night I was pursued by gipsies who had no good á
intentions.

My brother accused me undeservedly before my parents. I was not á
guilty. He was misled by his wife.

When I left my boyfriend. I found another girl at his home but he á
did nothing to relieve the situation.

I found a big black beetle in my coffee cup. It was alive big and á
it was moving its limbs.

When I had to prepare and read a paper to my fellow students but á
I didn't cope with the task.

I had thrown with the ashtray a still lighted cigarette in the á
plastic wastepaper basket. It had burnt out and my landlords made á
me a row that I might had set their flat on fire.

Some time ago I was present at the wedding party of two close á
friends of mine.

I was crossing the street together with some colleagues of mine á
when I suddenly found myself almost under the wheels of a truck.

Someone stole my ski at Vitosha and of course I was the one to be á
blamed. I left them without supervision.
I got separated form my closest friend. He went to work abroad.

A drunk man had fallen in the street and he was shouting obscene á
words.
I had borrowed some money and I exceeded the time-limit.
I couldn't fulfill a promise.

An encounter with a man whom I love, after a very long á
separation.

I woke up in the middle of the night of a nightmare, I was alone, á
it was very quiet and very dark.

A shop-assistant behaved rather roughly with me though she hadn't á
the slightest grounds for it.

I saw a friend of mine who had suffered a very heavy contusion á
after an accident.
I caught a glimpse of a black-beetle.
I was made a very sharp remark at a rehearsal.

I couldn't fulfill a request of a girlfriend of mine, though I á
categorically promised her and I believed there wouldn't be any á
hindrance. It was partly for objective reasons but also because á
I couldn't organize myself.
At a success of mine, at a real achievement.

I was looking after a dying patient at work one night, a young á
woman, my colleague was talking to her relatives and .... to á
offer them any support emotionally, physically and then sent them á
down to the coffee shop to have a dinner rather than offering the á
facilities available for their use cause it involved her having á
to do some work. Seeing them again I felt disgusted at her á
attitude.

I put on a lot of weight in a few months and every time I met á
someone I knew would avoid them, usually by hiding because my á
self image was low and I was ashamed of what I had done to á
myself.

I was involved in a ... attempt on a man I had developed a close á
warming relationship with. Although I knew I had done everything á
I could and that his progress of a "normal" life was poor I felt á
guilty as if I could have done more.
For the first time in my life telling someone I loved them.

When I was ringing up a guy who was my teen idol, and was in á
Auckland. I was really scared, I didn't know what to say or do.

When my mother decided to clean out my room and throw out what á
she thought was junk, without my knowing about it, so I returned á
home to find half my stuff gone.
When I couldn't find my dog which was missing.

I was disgusted with a friend's behaviour when she got absolutely á
drunk so that she vomitted all over my house.

I was taking place in an anti nuclear protest and was shouting á
protest loudly to some American sailors of the U.S. Texas á
submarine. A guy came up to me and said that's your brother á
screaming at, I felt shame and I realized screaming at another á
person isn't good protesting. Now I'm a silent protester.

I felt guilty after getting really angry with a friend and having á
an argument. I was being stubborn and proud, and selfish, because á
my friend let me down, through no fault of her own.

When I met my boyfriend and we discovered that we shared the same á
ideals and goals in life, and that we could share all our á
feelings and thoughts and felt that the world's not so bad when á
you have someone really close to share your life with.

I had called a boy who had dated me, and told him that I was ill, á
while, actually, I didn't want to go out with him, later on, he asked á
me if I was feeling better, then I felt ashamed.
When I hurt my parents in one way or another.
When I passed the driving test after three failures.
When I nearly caused a traffic accident with my car.

When playing a football match, there was one player who made mean á
tackels, kicked at everything and did things having nothing to do á
with football.

A close friend decided to stop with his study and to go back á
home.

We had a birthday party with 5 friends. One of us frequently used á
hard drugs. On the party I discovered that the other 3 friends á
also used them. While we agreed we would help the big user to á
stop using it.

During a family reunion, they started talking about me wearing an á
ear-ring.

It was my mother's birthday. My father and I used to buy a á
present together. However, now I had bought something together á
with my girlfriend and I forgot to ask my father.
For instance when a girl is interested in me and likes me.

Walking at friday night through Nijmegen, going to a pub or a á
disco.

I felt dusgust with a self-iterested person who ruined the life á
of another by means of utterly unfair methods.

I didn't do an important job and it had an adverse effect on á
other people.
I stroke a person undeservedly.

I sensed this feeling when I passed successfully the second tour á
of a competition.
I felt fear when my mother was heavily ill.

I felt anger against a colleague of mine during a rehearsal in á
acting. He hadn't learnt the text of an opera act in the course of á
several months and thus making difficulties for the rest of my á
colleagues.

I felt sadness when I had to get separated from the woman I loved á
who had to leave for her motherland.

I felt disgust with the alcohol, after I happened to see a young á
man, who was dead to the world and who wallowed on the pavement. á
This "sight" I watched from the bus.

I felt shame and I couldn't look into my teacher's eyes, after á
not attending his lectures.
I felt guilty after I battered to death a classmate of mine.

I was happy when at difficult times I could find support in my á
friend and my fiancT, I was happy because of their spiritual and á
moral help which gave me new power to struggle. I was happy then, á
I felt it in my soul.
I felt it at the same time when I felt disgust.

I felt it on the same occasion when I felt sadness which finally á
grew into anger.

My living and working conditions at home were unbearable. We used á
to live in a three room flat together with two more families. The á
discords caused a change - one of the families moved out. The á
other family stayed with us but I drifted away from my fiancT. In á
fact we were two families in the flat. Then I found myself alone á
in the struggle for this life because my fiancT did not stay next á
to me my grief and sorrow took on large proportions. I wanted to á
commit suicide but instead I threw myself against the cause of á
the irritation.

I am disgusted with my sister's husband. On an early Sunday á
morning after having knocked at my door, he suddenly rushed in á
and finching me still in bed he began quarrelling about á
something. I could not understand. I heard his last words: "Don't á
stare at me so because I'll beat you in your bed" I got up á
terrified and a thrashing followed.

I feel shame mixed with anger with the behavior of some á
incultivated people because my fiancT is a foreigner.

I felt guilt because on account of my ambitions I nearly turned á
my sister out of my parents home.

That was what I felt when I was finally accepted in the Bulgarian á
Conservatorie after I had applied a couple of years.

I experienced this feeling when the doctors found a nodule in one á
of my mother's breasts. It turned out to be an occlusion á
resulting from continious sucking but for a few days I was not in my á
reason.

I had an accident with a trafic police car that was packed at a á
curve without any visibility and against all traffic regulations á
in a strong snowstorm. As a result I still cannot repair my car á
because of the missing spare parts.

A sudden doubt made me run for a long time in a rainy autumn á
night. When I reached the intended place I saw my beloved in á
another man's arms. A sudden blow, grief, I cannot qualify it, it á
is painful for me to remember about it.

I felt disgust with a man I had trusted and respected, to whose á
problems I had always shown deep understanding.

I was given the task to learn a page of music text for a small á
part. But I had forgotten all about it and I felt quite awkward á
when I had to show what I had prepared.

Some time ago I slapped my son without trying to understand who á
the real culprit of a damage was. After that I felt guilty and á
bad but it was too late.
My boyfriend made me a proposal.

I was to be given an audition to get a role. I had a competitress á
and I wasn't well prepared because I was ill.

A whole crowd of us went to a folklore festival. The instructor á
of the cast where my boyfriend played was traveling with us. We á
decided to catch the train that leaved early in the morning á
because we had business on the following day. The instructor á
tried to get the upper hand and made us catch the train in spite á
of everything, all the time he made me angry.
When I quarrelled with my boyfriend.

I am disgusted with the fact that bad singers play at the opera á
(and not only there) only because they are protegTs or lovers of á
an important felow while at the same time some young and able á
singers work in a quite different field of life.

I feel shy to show all my worth when I work for the first time á
with a conductor or a producer unfamiliar to me.
I offended my mother.

When I heard what mark I had got at the entrance examination and á
I realized my admittance to the University was almost certain.

Once I was alone at home. I suddenly felt unwell and there was no á
one to help me and call First Aid.

When I was admitted to a Language school. On the day when I was á
informed by a message and my parents congratulated me.

When diving deep into the sea to reach the floor I felt á
breathless. I was cautious but I doubted I should be able to come á
to the surface and inhale.

When my friend (girl) promised to help me go to the hospital and be á
examined by good experts and she deceived me.

When I had stayed abroad for a long time and I had remembered á
about my friends and relatives. I felt sad and I wanted to see á
them as soon as possible.

I felt it when I saw our headmaster blushed ingratiating himself á
with high ranking officials.

When I hadn't learnt my lesson and I asked the teacher to give me á
"a three" and he agreed but even he felt quite awkward.
NB: In Bulgarian schools "a three" is the second worst mark.

When I shouted and quarrelled and for no reason I had been rude to my á
mother and when my behaviour had been influenced by other outward á
factors.

When you are satisfied with something, when you achieve something á
you have striven to.

One fears many things, for example one fears going to the á
dentist. but as far as I am concerned this feeling is connected á
with the examination session.

When you are unjustly assessed at something you are sure to have á
been right.

For the loss of a close friend or relative, but you feel grief á
when you are away from home, too.
They wanted something to happen but I didn't.
I couldn't be with a girl on whom I was very keen.

I and my friends got acquainted with a guy from Sofia who turned á
out to be gay, but we found that out only after 2 or 3 days.

My first girlfriend. I had the feeling that she was going out á
with me only because of my defect.
Years ago I ran away from home which disappointed my parents.
Having passed an exam.
Having a car accident.

I shared a secret with a friend and it later turned out that he á
had revealed it to another person with whom I didn't get along very well.
The loss of a very good friend.
Negative statement concerning me of a friend before strangers.

Adultery with the girlfriend of a friend of mine, of which he á
learned.
Adultery with a friend's girlfriend.

I'm glad when I have good relations with my colleagues and most á
of all when we are at a party.

I experienced it once when we were on a drive. Our car passed by á
the one comming from the opposite direction at an incredibly á
small distance.

I get angry with people who attain certain status without á
deserving it, only with the support, authority and influence of á
other people.

I feel sad when I see things done against men and nothing could á
stop it - at least I think so.

I have experienced disgust with some people - usually double á
dealers.

I am ashamed when I am not prepared in a subject and I have to á
answer in the presence of the patients.

I feel guilty when I should have done something at any rate but I á
haven't done it.

I experienced it when I was accepted at the Medical Higher á
Institute.
I felt it when I sat for my exam in anatomy.

I experience that feeling when I am unsulted without deserving á
it or when someone deceives me.
When my grandfather died.
I feel disgusted with toadies, hypocrites, chameleons.
When I do something unworthy.
When I offended my parents without wanting it.
After each successfully passed exam I am happy.

A friend of mine gave birth to a child. Very dangerous delivery. á
I was afraid for her and for the baby.

I get angry when someone imputes on me things I never can do, á
naturally negative. Servility, "connections", impudence, traits á
that get me mad.

My brother is a soldier. He promised to come home in a furlough á
but in the last moment he phoned and said that he could not come.
I am disgusted with liers, hypocrites, slanderers, flunkeys.

Recently I saw a young girl fawning on a man. And what for - á
money and things. I was ashamed to be a woman.
When I have been overhastingly offending or hurting.

After the term exams I happened to meet a person that I respect á
and of whom I think very highly. It was nice that although we see á
each other rarely he had not forgotten me.

Few years ago my father was very ill. He stayed at a hospital for á
a long time. Then I experienced that terrible feeling that I á
might lose him.

I have a friend that I deeply trusted but it happened that I lost á
my confidence in her for which she herself was to blame.

We are several friends but our characters are very different and á
we inevitably split in the two extremes. It is sad that I myself á
don't know what to do, I try not to hurt either of the "parties" á
because there are conflicts to which one I should belong.

I stayed for several weeks with a friend of mine before she moved á
to live with her husband. One evening he came drunk and made an á
awful scene, which I still remember.

In the past I experienced this feeling almost all the time - á
wherever I went, in different sutuations. I was small and I had á
to be taken to kindergarten, but me the fool didn't dare to tell á
exactly where, finally as a result I was late.

My roommate got married and invited me to share a flat with them. á
But with a young couple there should not be a third person. I am á
to blame for not following the advise of the others, but it is á
not late still.

I experienced this feeling when I was accepted as a student. á
Because everything turned out different from my expectations. á
Although I passed the exam successfully I was accepted as a á
student only when I didn't expect it at all, namely at the á
beginning of September.

In the real sense of the word I experienced fear in my first á
months in the army. During my first night of duty. The cause for á
all this was a bear. I became panic sticken (may be for the first á
time) and even forgot that I had a gun.

When I was a soldier I quarrelled with my commander and may be in á
revenge for this he detailed me on duty two successive nights. á
Naturally he checked me up on the second night and found me á
asleep for which he sent me to the cells.

Sometimes I experience sadness for the Sports High School and for á
my unrealized dreams in the sport. Anyway there I spent six years á
of my life.

Sort of awkward. I'd introduced (a lover) but introduced as a á
friend to some members of my family, and my niece Yavanna who's á
six was home from school and at Mum's and Dad's and was really á
silly and at first it was ok, but it went on and on - yukky pooh! á
You eat your snot, etc. and I felt cross she wouldn't stop. But á
she had an audience and was in one of those moods. Once I'd á
accepted it was something everyone does at time I felt better - á
it was partly having my friend there.

In my 20s - and was going out to dinner to celebrate a friend's á
birthday. Her (older - in 30s) cousin, really wanted me to get á
drunk cos I'd visited their (cousin & wife) place quite a bit, á
but had always been very careful - brought up to believe in á
moderation in drink (but not guilt repression etc). I mixed á
drinking with smoking (which I rarely did) and got drunk and had á
to leave the table to get sick in the loo, and later went home á
and was sick again; have never felt so awful in my life. And I á
didn't want to face or tell my other flatmates, or family.

I used to pinch change from my father's mantlepiece (never my á
mother - she didn't get enough housekeeping) and then I'd feel á
when we went to church as a family I'd felt awkward cos I felt á
I'm expected to go to communion and I would but I was afraid and á
guilty 'cos I committed a mortal sin.
Spontaneous picnic with sister and friend and children - great.
Can think of no time that I have felt fear.

Teenage neighbours smashed my letterbox for the fifth time in a á
couple of months. It was a deliberate action of kids who had á
stayed in my home, had meals there yet took a dislike to my á
daughter.
Guy I cared for went back to Canada to live.

Bus driver driving roughly - old man fell off seat into aisle - á
driver wouldn't stop - disgusted with her behaviour.

A daughter in court for staff pilfering, she was dressed like a á
"street walker" - I had a friend form overseas with me and was á
falsely trying to impress with my family.

Reported neighbour to police for taking to my daughter with á
baseball ball - her counsellor rang me and after long talk á
convinced me the woman was o.k. I felt guilty for ringing the á
police then guilty for feeling guilty about it.

Meeting with two of my friends I had not seen for 15 years. They á
were special people to me.

I was in the Korean War. We were attacked with mortars, me and á
companion. We stopped the jeep and ran for cover. Fortunately á
neither of us was hit but we both came close to being killed.

I've a situation of responsibility an employee who had a habit of á
being late, came late again after promising to say he would be at á
work in a few minutes, then arrived 3 hours later. He had been á
drinking.

My brother in law was dying of cancer. To see him wasting away á
was very sad.
Disgust at myself when I stroked a sleeping girl's private parts.

My son was apprehended for shoplifting at the age of 14. Because á
I too had been apprehended at the same age I felt the shame of á
not having been able to prevent my son from acting in the same á
way.

I removed an article of clothing belonging to my employer while á
in a position of trust.

When we took out an 84 year old woman for the evening and had á
hamburgers. She described the evening out as her happiest night á
out in 20 years.

While tramping on a narrow path two of us were confronted by a á
woman with two snarling dogs, demanding we get off the property - á
via a flooded river !

A friend got angry and drove "like a lunatic" with me and others á
in his car. I was angry about his dangerous driving.

A boy I look after for the probation service deliberately á
offended to provoke a reaction from the police.

4-letter words on a TV programme (Roche) while we were á
entertaining "conservative" relations who wanted to see the first á
episode.

A young visitor to the house stole money from an elderly á
visitor's purse. It wasn't noticed for some hours.

I had to leave an important function early because of family á
commitments. Someone else had to complete my job.

I was seriously injured in a road accident. The very first steps á
I took with only one crutch to support me I felt so good. I enjoy á
being alive.

I was attacked, standing in a doorway, by a pack of 5 dogs, á
alsatians and farm dogs with my escape route blocked by a shut á
fence.

In the house where I live there is a new flatmate. His friends á
unfortunately are the dirt of society, intelligent, fashonable, á
rich and bored. At a party recently they were doing things I á
didn't like done in my house. I felt angry at them.

I was driving near my girlfriend's house and I decided to keep á
going because it was late and I would be back in the next few á
days anyway. The next day she was killed in a road accident.

My girlfriend came home after a business dinner at the most á
expensive place in town drunk as a skunk. Whats more she drove á
home and couldn't remember doing so. I was disgusted by her state á
and her actions.

A good friend of mine told me in comfidence that once he had á
tried to commit suicide. To meet him you wouldn't think so. I á
told another friend of mine about this when she was feeling á
depressed about her twin brother's suicide. I broke a bond of á
confidentiality.

When I was young I stole something from a shop and got caught, á
then I was taken to the police station and my parents had to come á
and get me.

When I found out that a set task (i.e. 2 essays and a test), the á
thought of which had oppressed me, were not on the date I had á
thought.
When confronted and in my opinion hassled by the police.

Disgust - no. Maybe it is more precise to say revultion at a worm á
or a snake. But I mean it in a social aspect when somebody had á
behaved like a scoundrel to you, when by his actions he has made á
you change your attitude towards him but I thing this feeling the á
way I meant it, is not typical for the people interrelations.

When you betray the trust you have been given. This is connected á
with copying at a class-work at school.

When I have forgotten to warn somebody for something, or when I á
have forgotten to bring something I have been asked for.

When, for example, I was in my eleventh school year and I learned á
I had been classed for the Bulgarian Language and Literature á
National Olympiad.

When, for example, my grandfather fell seriously ill. It was á
necessary for him to be operated and I felt great fear of losing á
him because he is so dear to me.

When, for example, I was not approved to continue my studies at á
the Moscow University, no matter that I had the highest marks and á
in general the best records of all the candidates.

When, for example, I left for the first time my parents and I á
went to live in Sofia.
When, for example, someone is calumnating.
When, for example, I fail in my undertakings.

For example, when I have promised something but I haven't á
fulfilled it.

Some time ago a close relative of mine got off cheap with the á
worst.
The last time I felt it was when I was coming home late at night.
I haven't often felt this feeling. Once someone stole my garment.
Recently I happened to remain alone for a long time.

I don't remember about a situation when I have experienced this á
feeling. Maybe it was when I saw a drunkard in the street.
I lied to my best friend and I wouldn't reform what I had done.
It happens to me quite often. I can't describe a particular case.

Realizing one's desire, an experienced feeling of satisfaction á
from the realization of one's desires and aims.

Fear of the loss of a close friend, of feeling the ground slipping á
from under my feet.

Attitude to some manners of dealing and some "sanctioned" á
relations.

Feeling unable to preserve one's ideas and ambitions as innocent á
as they are when you are young.
Attitude to a related family.

Exaggerating certain circumstances, wrong attitude and evaluation á
of these circumstances.
Low evaluation of other people's cares.
I won a sport contest.
If a close relative's life is in danger.
A close person lied to me.
Getting separated from my girlfriend.
Encouter with a prostitute.
A theft committed by me.
Lack of respect for my parents.
When my son was born.
Before an examination.
Unjust punishment of a friend of mine.
After the loss of a close relative.

When somebody behaves like a scoundrel. Recently a colleague of á
mine used the name of another one for his own benefit.

I travelled on a bus and I forgot to punch the ticket. A ticket á
collector came in and I had to pay the fine. I did it with a feeling á
of shame.
I forgot to convey an important announcement.
Meeting a loved man.

I felt a physical fear, if I can call it this way, today, in the bus where á
I was sitting on the first seat. While turning the driver didn't á
see the tram which was making a dash towards us (coming from the á
side I was), and whose driver intended to cross in yellow á
light.

At an unjust, or to be more precise, at a bureaucratic treatment á
of one's personality.
When one is alone and knows that all the others are celebrating.
At the sight of an insect, such as the black-beetle.

When not fulfilling any of my obligations to a person whom I á
respect.

When something unpleasant happens to a friend or relative of á
yours and you are at the bottom of it.

I sensed such a feeling when I understood I was admitted to the á
University. I was at home, the atmosphere was still, though I á
myself was full of suspense. I tried to do different things. When á
the telephone rang and...! Yes, of course there were other á
situations when I felt a similar feeling but I was unmindful of á
them.

This feeling I sensed quite recently. It was arisen by the á
terrific thought that I might lose the man I loved !

Anger I felt when my boyfriend told me he didn't mind breaking it á
off with me, i.e. each of us to take his own road. Because until á
that moment, he deliberately restricted our dates. The motives á
were brought to my knowledge later.

Sometimes, when I'm alone I am seized by this feeling. But it á
always helps me to come round and at the same time to judge if it á
is worth. Very often this feeling is caused to me by people - á
friends who I love and respect.

Such a feeling springs up in me sometimes when I have meals at a á
catering establishment. It is a result either of the look of the á
food or when watching the way some people eat.
This happens to me when I am not prepared in a given subject.

Quite unconsciously I offended a girlfriend of mine. It was á
really worthy to pass this fact over in silence, but I acted so, á
because I believed I was right. In fact it often happens to me to á
feel guilt, after I have already done the deed.
When I was admitted to the University.

I had to have my tonsils out. I had been making up my mind almost á
for a year - I was afraid. But during the two hours in the á
hospital room, while I was waiting to be called for the operation I á
felt a real fear - of the pain, of what they were going to do to á
me, of the unknown.

In a conversation my boyfriend expressed definite and quite á
pretentious opinions and he took up an attitude towards a theory á
which he himself had never known. His information was from á
fortuitous sources.

Summer, heavy rain, storm - I was standing with my face stick to á
the window: the childhood, something was going away forever this á
summer, I was leaving my home, I was going to study in another á
town, for the first time I was leaving my parents, friends, I had á
to manage myself, a long and loved period of my life was over - I á
was crying.
I saw in the street a man spitting.

I talked with a man who stammered and without controlling myself, á
I started to talk imitating him.
Always, and this happens often when I do not keep my word.
When I understood that I was admitted to the University.

I felt this feeling when one day my landlord's cat had crept á
under my bed and I couldn't cope with it during an hour and a á
half.

I feel this feeling when I am to fill in a questionnaire or a á
form.
When the man I loved decided to leave me forever.

I have felt this feeling when a person whom I believe and respect, á
lied to me.

I feel shame when sometimes, (unconsciously) I behave unethically á
and without understanding the problems of the man I love.
When I offend somebody unfairly.

A quarrel was followed by the decision of leaving a person close á
to me. Several days later my regret was great. I was beside á
myself. Quite unexpectedly he came and the conflict was calmly á
solved. I was glad at the possibility to be with him.

One evening I was watching the news on TV. Again they were á
talking about the danger of war. Suddenly I imagined what it á
might mean for me, for my friends, for the people close to me. I á
felt it a very near and possible event.

Unfair and unjust attitude toward a person close to me, what I á
was the witness of, caused anger in me.

The thought that I'll never sit at the school desk again, caused á
a deep grief at the end of my eleventh form.

I felt disgust with a person whose behaviour was out of the á
elementary human norms.

I had not punched a ticket in the bus because I had a card. But á
when the ticket-collector came it turned out that I had forgotten á
it. The shame I felt was great though it was not done on purpose.

At a moment of affect I offended a person very close to me. He á
had given me ground for that but it was a trifling in comparison á
with the way I insulted him. A moment later I felt a sense of á
guilt.
When I understood I was admitted to the Sofia University.

I broke my knee when I was skiing over "Yastrebetz" (a racing á
track in a Bulgarian winter resort).

The doctors from Belogradchik town determined a wrong diagnosis á
to my son. A month later, after some complex examinations at ISUL á
(A medical institute in Sofia), the diagnosis was categorically rejected.

My son lives with my parents in the country and I feel this á
feeling always when leaving for Sofia, but the last time it was á
quite strong.

A colleague of mine asked a lecturer to put him a higher mark in á
order to keep his good mards and thus to continue getting a á
scholarship for an excellent grade.
I felt this feeling during the exam in higher mathematics.

My son drank four pills of diazepam every two hours instead of á
amidophen.

I am a sportwoman as well. I felt joy when after an year of á
practice, at a contest, I covered the norms for "a master of sports".

I felt fear once, when the car in which I travelled directed á
towards the precipice along the road.

When I see how people around me pass by certain unjustice because á
of indifference or cowardice.
When I left a man in whom I really believed.
Disgust with drunk people.
When I try to lie.

When I had had the possibility to act or to do certain activity á
better but I had not done it because of reluctance or á
carelessness.
When I was admitted to the University.
When I broke my leg I felt fear.
When someone lies to me.
At an unjust insult or injure.

From the cigarette smoke. Usually I feel disgust from it when I á
am in a restaurant.
When I promise to do something but I don't fulfill it.
When I don't fulfill my obligations.
When my affairs with the girl I love settled positively.

In a dam lake, when the water was let flow to water the plants á
and I and two other boys were near the water pit. We rescued á
ourselves only thanks to the flippers and the tyre that was with á
us.

It was quite recently, at the football match between the national á
teams of Bulgaria and France. I felt strong anger with the Scottish á
referee who ran the match quite partially.

When I am alone and listen to a song which I like very much and á
which I had listened before together with friends.
A striking act of ingratitude at a public vehicle.

I counterfeited a mark in the school register during the lesson á
in gymnastics. I felt this feeling two days later when I stood á
face to face with my teacher, whom I highly appreciated and á
respected.

In a fit of temper I told things that were unjust and they á
greatly hurt my mother though she didn't show it.

I passed successfully the preliminary exam for a participation in á
the children Assembly.

I was alone in my room at the boarding house when at 12 o'clock á
someone knocked violently on the door.

A friend of mine promised to come with me to the cinema but he á
didn't come.

I felt sadness when I remembered my former boyfriend with whom I á
got separated an year ago and when comparing him with my present á
one with whom things are not much of a success.

Recently in the tram, a man ran his fingers over my girlfriend á
then over me.

I had to prepare a report but I couldn't write it. I read from a á
book off-hand, I was quite uneasy and I felt I didn't manage.

My father got a slight heart attack after a telephone call of á
mine.
Bulgaria won a football match against France.
I was going to knock down a pedestrian with my car.
I was neglected undeservedly.
My grandmother died.
A man was unfair to a girlfriend of mine.
I didn't offer my seat to a pregnant woman in the bus.
I didn't attend lectures.
I felt joy when my two twin sisters were born.

The night before my wife had given birth to our twins. I felt á
fear in the hospital yard, I feared if everything was going to be á
in order.

About a month ago the Regional Council refused to pay my wife the á
due maternity benefit, because of bureaucratic reasons.

Some months ago my wife gave birth to twin sisters. She had no á
idea of looking after babies and she felt quite oppressed. The á
fact that I couldn't help her caused grief to me.

I feel disgust with some people when I see what they are capable á
of, including lack of any dignity, when trying to find a seat in á
the tram.

Some days ago I had a car accident. It was quite slight but á
through my fault. I felt strong shame because I had the spirits á
of a good driver.
Some days ago I had a slight car accident through my fault.

The period when I was pregnant and when I gave birth to my son. á
I can say those were the happiest months in my life.

A fear from the loss of a close friend as a result of his á
behavior.

When I encountered not only with my father's lack of á
understanding but also with his unwillingness to understand me as á
a parent, as far as things for which I (not he) have proves to be á
right are concerned.
From the fact that my husband and I are not in good terms.

I was disgusted from a quarrel between two married people, in á
which the children were involved as accusers of one of the á
parents.
When I don't succeed to fulfill a promise.

When I am not able to fulfill any request of my son - can't take á
him out to ride his byke, because I am tired.

I felt joy when I saw my daughter after a separation of twenty á
days.

I felt fear when I sat for one of my exams. Though my fear was á
not quite justifiable, I still remember about it.

I thought him a good friend but he tried to lie to me several times. á
Last time was the height of impudence. He promised he would come á
home but he didn't. I felt a sense of anger and insult.
A fear of lack of personal powers.

At an undeserved attitude toward a man, when human personality is á
not treated decently.
At an irrevocable loss (with respect to human relations).

At an unworthy behaviour of a man, pettiness, stupidity and á
mostly at a philistinism.
At a weakness on my part.
When I don't justify the confidence of people that I respect.
When I was admitted to the University.

Because of a conflict with my parents there was a possibility to á
interrupt my studies.
I feel a strong anger when I am treated unjustly.
At a prolonged separation with my family.

I was looking for an object when I came across a rotten corpse of á
a rat.

I feel this feeling at one and the same degree when I am not á
prepared to overcome certain obstacle in my life.

I offended a person who had done much for me and who had helped á
me for everything.
The day when my son said for the first time "mummy".
Before an exam in logics.

My husband and I were invited at the house of our nieghbours then á
we got an invitation on the part of my parents which we had to á
refuse. A a result they called me by words that provoked my á
anger.

My son lives in the country. I feel sadness when I see mothers á
having walks with their children.

The behaviour of a colleague of mine, which doesn't correspond to á
my norms of behaviour.

I was to take part in a cocktail party on the occasion of our á
national holiday as a servant.
I ignored and offended my parents on the eve of the New Year.

The sense of joy comes to me always after a period of depression, á
as an organic feeling for an upsurge. I don't exclude the á
situative feeling but in this case the reason is not in me, it's á
out of me.

I bet that I would jump down from a window. I was sure that I á
would jump but before I did it I rather felt fear.

A honest "sliding" on the part of a girlfriend of mine. á
Terribly crossed I started breaking things and tearing books.

Alone I am coming back home in the night after the serial á
"explanation".
A lie on the part of a person close to me.
I thought I had taken a decision but I hesitated.

I feel this feeling most often before me not before the others. á
My outside is iron but actually I'm wasting away.
My son was born.
I had a car accident.

I was drawn up a statement for an infringement of the traffic á
ordinance. In fact I was innocent.
I lost a close friend.

I saw a film about the nazi concentration camps during the war. á
After the film I felt disgust.

I was nailed. I lied in connection with a book which I took from á
the library, because I had to keep it for a longer time.

I didn't give back in time some money that I had borrowed. My á
friend relied on them.

After 10 days of hard work and having suffered many changes I á
passed my last exam.
Before going to the dentist.

When I am made to do things in which I see no sense and I waste á
my time. Some time ago I had to participate in a sociological á
investigation and then I got really angry.

When I feel I must be with somebody, to talk with somebody - but á
I am alone.

Some time ago a man tried to teach me something. "Tried" because á
it is very difficult to teach somebody when you yourself are not á
competent and cultured.

I am ashamed when I am not ready for my seminar in internal á
diseases, simply because the assistant professor is a person who á
deserves high respect.

We had promised, with a friend of mine, to take our friends to a á
restaurant and after having looked for a place for hours without á
finding one, and not being helped by the others we had to give up á
the idea.

When I am with friends and I do what pleases me this often á
happenes.

When I have to go in for an exam and the examinor is a person á
with a whimsical character and unsteady requirements.

I unfairly got a low mark on an exam and I failed to win a grant, á
since then I don't have much confidence in myself at an exam.
It happened that I was alone - with no contacts with friends.

I met three drunk boys, almost children, they didn't look like á
normal people.

I was totally unprepared for a seminar conducted by an assistant á
professor whom I highly respect.

I got back too late after a Sunday going out without having á
called up home to tell where I was. my mother hadn't slept the á
whole night.

I was happy when I understood that the girl I liked was in love á
with me.
I am afraid before an exam or colloquium.

I get angry when my smaller brother misbehaves and talks with indecent á
words.
When my dog was stolen.

I detest any kind of constraint and hate the attempts of elder á
people to force me to a norm of behavior without having legal or á
moral rights to do it. I felt this emotion when a neighbour of á
mine made me kick out my guests because they had talked very á
loudly and threatened that with "connections" she will expel me á
from the inst.

I experienced long ago when I was sightseeing Bulgarians in a á
foreign language.

My mother developed hipertonia and I think I too am to blame á
bacause with her it is a stress disease.
When I met with friends that I hadn't seen for a long time.

One evening a friend of mine was telling a fearful story, nobody á
took it seriously but I got frightened.

I got angry with a stranger in a train who behaved impertinently á
and immorally
When I failed at the first entrance exam.
The event which got me angry got also an aversion in me.
Once I was not ready for a seminar and I was asked to leave.
I felt guilty when once I made my mother angry.

Six months ago when I got acquaintanced with a person whom I á
trusted infinitely and from whom I expected help and friendly á
feelings. With him I found much in common - in our views and in á
our fate.

Few days ago I really experienced fear. It was connected with á
unexpected actions on the part of a group of people. This evoked á
in me many negative emotions.

I always get angry when somebody deceives me, or tries to conceal á
his lie skilfully and this offends me even more.

Sadness - this is an emotion which I have felt very often á
recently. I can't remember a concrete example. I will describe my á
general impression from severl situations which evoked this á
feeling in me.

I became disgusted with the man on whom I had counted, who I had á
trusted, the man who should have been my mainstay - my father. á
I could hardly make myself (and the others) believe in this á
emotion. It has cumulated after events and deeds. Everything can á
happen in this world.

I am ashamed of the way my father behaves with my mother and á
sister, and with me too.

I didn't keep a promise I had made to a man, and in this way I á
lost his esteem and confidence in me. I caused him a lot of á
trouble.
When I was accepted as a student.

I was a bit frightened when it was found that there was something á
wrong with my liver. However it turned out that it was not á
serious and I need not worry.

With the girl whom I may be loved truly. When she refused to come á
with me to an occasion (she was from another town).

For the girl who halped me go on living and made me happy - when á
I don't see her even for two or three days.

For a drunk man (about 20 years old) that I met one evening, and á
who behaved impudently with the girls standing by.

I was embarassed at the exam in microbiology. I was ashamed with á
myself - how little I knew and how good was the examinor. I á
rarely become ashamed.

Recently when I made a slip and blurted out indecent words in my á
mother's presence.

I felt it when on duty in the hospital I understood that I was á
not afraid to face death, that I also helped a little to relieve á
the pains of a patient.

Fear overwhelmed me when right against the car I was in I saw á
another one, as if out of control of the driver.

I felt it when a girl who was dear to me lied to my face. I got á
angry with the fact that she knew I didn't believe her but she á
kept on telling lies.
Sadness, no, I felt something much stronger when my father died.

I got disgusted with a man who was beating a woman in the street. á
I just happened to be there but I was abhorred by the rudness.

I was ashamed of the way I deceived that I could not help a á
friend, although it was absolutely possible for me. Nothing was á
revealed but I haven't called up this person since then.

I had an appointment with a colleague of mine to give her my á
lecture notes. I couldn't go and I didn't send them, and so the á
girl missed a day for the preparation of her term exams.
When I knew that my husband and I were going to have a child.

Two years ago I saw a film on the TV. Even now it makes me á
afraid.
When my husband stays late at a meeting and I have to be alone.
The loss of a person I loved very much.
Deception from a person I loved very much.

I didn't tell my parents that I was going to Sofia. I told them á
that I was going to a seminar. My mother knew that I was lying but á
she didn't stop me.

The assistant professor saw me cheat at the preliminary á
examination.

I was very happy when I got the message that I had been accepted á
as a student in medicine.

I felt something close to that when I saw that there was a man on á
the terrace of the flat.

I got angry when I learned how short a time we had to prepare for á
the term examinations.

I felt sad when my first boyfriend and I left each other. It was neither á
his fault nor mine.

I felt it today when the bus driver shouted rather indecent words á
at a man without any reason whatsoever.

At an exam in pharmacology I tried to prompt a coleague (she á
asked me something) and the assistant professor made me a sharp á
remark.

My grandmother has been in a hospital for a week and I still á
haven't had time to see her.

When I learned that my parents were going abroad and leaving me á
alone for a few years.

I was at the seaside and my brother disappeared for a couple of á
hours.

Some time ago I was disgusted with the "cleanness" of the á
refectory of our institute.

We were at a football match and when we were leaving the stadium á
(the stadium was packed with people) and I lost my shoe in the á
crowd. Our attempts to find it didn't give any result and I had á
to go home without one shoe. In other words to cross the whole á
town !

I felt guilty last year during the winter term exams. A colleague á
of mine asked me to give him my lecture notes (I had very good á
notes and I had passed my exam in advance) but I still don't know á
why I didn't give them to him. That colleague failed and he was á
on the verge of not passing it at the supplementary examinations.

When I was admitted to the Institute. I had problems with many á
people about my applying for this institute and I decided to á
prove that one can pass excellently without visiting any á
preparatory couse. That is - I proved what I could do on my own.

Once as a child I dreamed of a fire. Since that time I hadn't á
wanted to sleep in that bed and had feared the night darkness á
(and so it is now).

A chief was unjustly punished on an autumn brigade and the one á
who was really guilty kept silent. I stepped in front and told á
the truth. The guilty chief called me in after the roll-call and á
threatened me.

Years ago I fell in love for the first time. as natural for every á
school-girl I was day-dreaming. Later (after 3 years) we left á
each other. No one was to blame but I felt deep sadness. Even now á
I remember about it quite often.

It was at a comsomol(??) meeting, the last one because we were to á
graduate. The way one of my fellow-students behaved made me feel á
disgusted.

I was at a children's camp abroad. The people (the leaders, my á
coevals) were very king to us. One night we smeared our foreign á
friends with tooth-paste while they were sleeping and then we á
roused the whole camp by our shouts. Later I was so sorry. I á
didn't utter a word for two days, then I went to apologize.

When I was in the fifth class the rating was done in our á
mark-books. I hadn't been examined yet but I had heard from my á
classmates about the scolding they had got at home. My first á
mark was in geography - good 4. I judged I had known for more á
than that and I put down "very good" for fear of being scolded. á
Naturally my parents guessed all about it. They rebuked me for á
what I had done.

When I learned I was admitted to study what I wanted most - á
floriculture (this is a narrow specialization from the general á
one).

I was walking on the pavement when a white car rolled on it and á
directed towards me. I was quite near the house wall when it á
rolled by and hit me.

My grandmother's brother had taken active part in the resistance á
movement. He had been in prison many times and there he lost his á
health. He became an invalid. When we phoned to First Aid the á
nurse on duty behaved quite unkindly when she understood how old á
he was (79).

My boyfriend is a soldier. He was on a leave. I felt sad when we á
had to get separated again.

I felt disgusted about a teacher who had rejected all that was á
human in her. She refused to accept the flowers we gave her for á
the eighth of March and asked for a foreign parfume instead.

I was examined by a teacher I greatly respected. I was well á
prepared on the subjects but he put some side-issues to me and I á
couldn't answer.

I had undertaken to help my sister for her class work but some á
unexpected circumstances prevented me from doing that.

I was very glad when I learned I was a student already. I heard á
about it over the phone, I didn't believe it at first.
I had worries about a certain illness.

I suffered from a gynaecological illness. I was quite displeased á
to hear that my roommates had talked about it and they had á
misrepresented the truth. I felt deeply hurt when I learned that á
it was done by a "good" acquaintance of mine.

When my first boyfriend left me. I tried not to let him á
understand I felt miserable.

I hate hypocrisy. My friend (girl) tried to intrude into my á
affairs with my future husband. After that she behaved as if á
nothing had happened.

I feel shame when I have made a promise, I can't keep it and this á
has negative effects which are caused by my behavior.

I felt it when I came home after the examination session and I á
said I had not passed my last exam.

I felt glad when I took the rather difficult organic chemistry á
examination.

This was what I felt when my boyfriend went to Bourgas to study á
there. I had the feeling I would lose him. Anyway the distance á
Plovdiv-Bourgas seemed to me so great.

I confronted with this feeling at the Institute quite recently, á
the pedology lecturer was the cause.

This feeling was quite deep when my friend (girl) died in a car á
accident.

I am disgusted with the behavior of a car driver whose car would á
run over me and my friends during our autumn brigade.
I felt shame when I discontinued my education for eight months.

The sense of guilt came over me too, when I interrupted my á
studies. Why ? Because I felt guilty before my parents ! They á
believed in me though this event did not make them disbelieve me.

I sensed a strong feeling of joy when in the plant, at my working á
place, I got a message that I was admitted as full time student at á
the Higher Agricultural Institute.

Fear when fulfilling my obligations on my first night fatigue á
duty as a soldier.

When on a car journey a fellow student crossed our way with his á
own car and we had to bump into a roadside trunk.
The loss of a close relative who was ill with cancer.

I am disgusted with a nieghbour who is looking for all sorts of á
quarrel with my parents and me. He feels we are hampering his á
living close to us. This has been going on for quite a long time.

Some time ago I promised to meet an acquaintance of mine and to á
carry him some promised papers. I haven't done it until this day. á
Now I feel quite awkward when I meet him.

A sense of guilt before my parents when I had to discountinue my á
studies in the first year because of unpassed exams.

After a difficult exam. When I had not hoped to take it and had á
got a high mark. When you present someone with something and he á
feels glad.

Fear from the unknown. I felt fear when I sat for the entrance á
examinations.

I feel angry at people's indifference at our ability to be á
present at an event and to stay partial to what happens.

When you are far away from relatives and friends. I feel sad for á
my early years, for the freedom and the carefree years of á
childhood.
I feel disgusted with the bootlickers, with helpless people.
I feel ashamed when I act dishonestly toward somebody.

I didn't visit a very close friend at the hospital and some days á
later he died.

I was sitting for an exam in biochemistry, I was very excited á
because it was a supplementary examination. I passed the exam á
very well and was glad because I recovered my selfconfidence.

Students fear many things but we seem to fear the examinations á
most of all. I remember I was horror stricken before my á
microbiology exam, because it was a decisive one.

It was necessary to organise a competition in connection with a á
celebration. Everyone was to be present at that event. It turned á
out that there was no audience at all because everyone had á
pretended to be very intelligent and no one had come. I got á
furious.

When I part with my friends I feel always sad for some time. I á
can't remember a concrete example now. For example I have just á
parted with a friend of mine and I am feeling sad.

In autumn I had to move to another lodging. My landlords, quite á
intelligent people, warned me I had to move in the nearest á
future. But I had difficulties in moving my luggage because I á
couldn't wait for a car to come. How amazed I was to hear them á
threatening me they would throw our my things. And at that my á
luggage was well packed and did not stand in their way. I was á
quite  disappointed and disgusted.

During our last exarcise in agricultural machines we went out in á
the yard to examine a row of machines. But we seemed not to have á
fulfilled our task well, because when our teacher came and asked á
me a question I was unable to answer. I felt awkward because he á
didn't deserve it.

I remember about an unpleasant event in relation to my mother. I á
felt guilty before her.

When I succeded in establishing a contact with a girl (who is now á
my girlfriend).
I fear before each exam.
When my bosom friend tried to lie to me.
When I quarrelled with a very close friend of mine.
When I see the acts and deeds of a blind drunk man.

When I wasn't well prepared for a terminal exam and the teacher á
tried to give me a three by asking me some very easy questions. I á
burned with shame then.

When once my mother asked me to do some work for her at home á
because she was busy and moreover this work was to be done by a á
man. But it remained undone.

I feel joy usually after each taken exam, the last one was in á
February.

It was not long ago when I and two of friends of mine got quite drunk á
and one of them began to rave under the influence of the alcohol. á
I felt fear of what could have happened.

I felt anger at my last exam, I felt angry with our teacher, á
because he did not rate me objectively and I failed.

I met a girl some time ago and I cared very much about her but it á
happened so that we left each other. I felt some sort of sadness, I think á
I can call it so.

I had a very good friend (boy) and I thought I could rely on him á
but he behaved badly with a girl who used to trust us completely.

Immediately after the New Year holidays I happened to visit a á
party where there was a lot of alcohol and I became drunk. On the á
next day I felt sort of ashamed when I remembered what I had said á
and done on the night before.

Last year I put off an exam for the autumn session without á
knowing if there was a supplementary examination session. When I á
came home with my exam unpassed I felt guilty before my parents á
when I remembered how much they had done for me.
When I was admitted to the Higher Institute.

I felt fear when I fell down and broke my leg into pieces and I á
could not feel it at all.

I felt angry when I failed in an exam about which I knew quite a á
few things and I did not deserve to be plucked.

When my mother and father were on an excursion in Chechoslovakia á
and I was at a student camp and I heard over the radio about the á
events that were taking place there.

I felt disgust with alcohol in general when a close friend of á
mine got so drunk that he didn't realize what he was doing and it á
was quite shameful.

I felt ashamed when my parents found out that I had deceived á
them.

I felt guilty when I had taken the car keys and I had an accident á
but as my parents did not know who was to blame, they punished my á
brother because I had no driving licence and they thought it á
impossible that had driven the car.

I felt joy when I was admitted to the Higher Agricultural á
Institute.

I feel fear quite often but this feeling was very strong last á
year when my husband was quite unexpectedly sent to the hospital.

That was what I felt with a teacher who put down quite unreal á
marks.

I felt sad when a friend of mine died and I felt that something á
had irrevocably gone away from me.

I felt disgust with a lady teacher who used to nag, to mock, to á
interrupt everyone of my fellow students each time we had a class á
with her in our first year.

That was what I felt when I told my first lie and then was á
cought.

I felt guilty when I failed to take an exam though I had had á
enough time to read for it but I hadn't made use of it.

I was for the first time on a brigade this year. At that time my á
sister was to bear a child. I was mad with joy when I opened the á
telegram from my parents and learned I had a nephew.

It was some years ago when one evening some people came home and á
told us my father was badly injured in an accident.

I faced this feeling when I realized I wasn't admitted to the á
institute in the first classifying, in spite of the high mark I á
had got at the entrance examination.á

Always when I get separated from my friends and relatives from my á
home town.

I feel disgust with my first boyfriend who made fun of our love á
in an abominable way.

I have always felt ashamed for some people's behavior to their á
too old parents. I have felt hurt and shy when they have left á
them to the mercy of fate.

I feel always guilty before my parents when I come home and have á
to tell them I have failed an exam.

Naturally when I got myself discharged this was my second á
birthday.
When I failed my first exam at the Higher Institute.

A nuisance used to live in our flat a month ago. I experienced á
this feeling when I tried to chase her out.
After my father's death.
With an alcoholic.

Once I had dinner at an elegant restaurant and I did not have á
enough money to pay the bill. There were a lot of people there á
and I felt quite awkward.

Something very unpleasant happened when I was a soldier and I was á
directly involved in it.

I felt the greatest burst of joy when after being heavily ill for á
a long period, my father came back home.

I was terrified during an axcursion in Italy. I was lost and left á
alone in this unfamiliar country.

I took part in a football match. The referee was extremely á
partial to the opposite team. This stirred up my discontent and á
anger.
When my first girlfriend an I left each other.

During a summer holiday at a bar I happened to see a dead to the á
world woman.
When I first had a sexual intercourse.

I remember when I was a little boy I broke a Swiss dinner set á
quite involuntarily.

When I got a message that I was employed as a nurse at a á
kindergarten.
When I first sat for an entrance examination.

When a teacher though pretending to be a highly cultivated á
teacher and a man, slapped a classmate of mine in the face quite á

When I got separated from my first love.

Many times, when my father used to come home drunk and maltreated á

When for the first and the last time I tried to crib and the á
teacher was with her back to me but right when I was taking the á
materials out she turned round and saw me.

When at times unconscienciously I speak to my mother in a high á
tome but after that I am sorry and I feel guilty.

Being invited out by a person I wished to get closer to. He á

Watching a horror movie with friends.

The breakup of a relationship. After the event I was upset/sad á
then angry maybe 2/3 weeks later.

The funeral of a friend who was killed in a car accident. She was á

Disgust for a person who treated me badly, and has treated other á

deceitful, unfair, etc.

Losing my temper and allowing myself to act childishly by yelling á
and screaming at a person who I felt had done me wrong - in á
effect lowering myself to their level.

Guilt at often being unable to visit a close relative in hospital á
after her death I felt very guilty and wished I had done more.

Achievement of a task by a friend who had begun a new job. She á
wasn't confident of handling the situation so was thinking  of á
leaving the job only after 2 days employment.

Walking home at night after university - part of the way, there á
are ano lights and I am walking down a thoroughfare with the á

When my son omits to carry out certain duties at home that he á
knows needs doing.

When I saw my niece (5 yrs) crying in the hallway for her mother á

With a woman who had walked into my place of employment and á
urinated on the floor in front of everyone.

When I found a letter addressed "To Mum" by my son, 6 months á
later, he begged me not to sell his new shoes which he messed up á
after wearing them for the first time.

When I had lied to a friend/son about some things we had á
discussed and I had to be one better.

Felt joy a few years ago when I was away on holiday. And sat very á
close to my best friend looking straight into the eyes.

I had to tell someone that I was interested in remaining celibate á
and alone. And that my spiritual master strictly prohibited á
sexual relations outside of marriage. This caused great fear á
through lack of conviction afraid to hurt someone's feelings á
despite my own being hurt in the process.

In a sociology class I felt very angry towards some members of á
society for exploiting the Polynesian people, dawn raids by á
Police (Martin Luther King, Blacks in S.A.). But this was just a á
reflection of my own shortcomings.

Felt sad about some street kids in QUEII square, Aotea square. á
Because they had been sniffing glue and some were very young. I á
went into the role of a performing clown.

I was disgusted by my paranoid attitude towards myself, my á
homework at university and disgusted about my lack of retention. á
Especially in learning another language.

I felt shame at the hurt I caused to my family especially my á
parent father, shame of hurting people emotionally. A misconceived á
self-blaming that didn't do me any good. Shame at being myself as á
I am.

I felt guilty at being part of the successful people. Felt guilty á
at being a student when other people were not. Guilt about being á
a potential success in various areas of society. (So stupid this á
emotion)

When I meet old past pupils of mine - and find they are all doing á
well - I feel joy. Yesterday I met a young woman (20 yrs) I'd á

3-4 yrs; she was no longer a waitress but a meter maid for á
Council.

A Maori language oral test, yeaterday - Although I had studied á
intensely - once in the examiners room "I blew it" -  I was so á
nervous I couldn't reply easily - It was very important, but I á
got only blankness.

A friend visited and made comments that my house/garden were not á
as neat/tidy as in the past. I'd not seen her a year - She á
implied I'd gone to the pack (I'd only been working full time, á
and taking 3 University exams part time).

When my father a 4th/5th generation colonial (from Eng.) attacked á
me verbally about my chosen partner. A man whom he discarded á
because his colour skin was not white. His ultimate disgust á
saddned me.

People who came to our home - and requested "Put out your smoke". á
That we should not smoke in our house... and asked not even á
politely. It disgusted me because I think people need to adapt to á
the situation.

Put down by my father - at a family outing at mutual family á
friends dinner. Told "Not to Speak". The attitude by him was á
negative/I was in mid 20s, I had done many things - a wide range á
of experiences. Probably greater than he.

Not attending school, when  am not sick - but in need of mental á
rest. Staff on your return query your "sickness" - it is easier á
in N.Z. to be sick, rather than confide other personal reasons á
etc.
My 3 children - each top his class in the final exams 1984.

A truck (big one) nearly mowed me off the road (I was driving a á
small Lazer).

A shop in Downtown wouldn't accept my Visa Card - before December á
last year.

My dog of 16 and 1/2 years - "Lord Grey" died in his sleep - His á
death caused me more and deeper sadness than I thought.
A sour looking man was beating his thin dog in Remuera.

I told Mr Winter of Downtown Fashion to go to - when he did not á
accept my Visa !
When I accepted a lunch invitation from a past male friend.
When my daughter was born.

When my mother entered surgery for a quadruple heart bypass. I á
felt intense fear at the time she was actually wheeled away.

When my husband got picked up in our new car for drunken driving. á
We had made a pact the other would not drink and so therefore á
would be the driver for the evening etc. I was not present at the á

When my grandmother died very suddenly without warning.

When the N.Z. rugby union announced that they would proceed with á

When I was unable to respond to a welcome in my indigenous á

When I made an excuse to get out of participating in an important á

Being reunited with my family after not having seen them for 5 á

I caught a huge eel on a fishing line which I had pulled into the á
boat. I cut the line and threw the whole lot back into the water. á
Later that day and about ten miles away I went swimming and á
someone made the comment wondering how far eels could swim, I á
abruptly ended swimming for fear at an unseen eel for a few days á
until we had left the district.

My partner without discussing with me the situation decided it á
was time for us to have a break and went ahead and arranged his á
own life for the next 6-12 months, then told me the day before it á
was about to happen having been tolerant and friendly for the á

I had been living in an overseas city and made the decision to á
leave the city and come home about 12 months before I met a whole á
new set of friends, leaving them at the airport was sad and á
traumatic as they had helped me in many ways and I knew I á
wouldn't see many of them again.

After I had managed to fail my first year at University I was á
scared as to what I was going to do with my future. I didn't want á

through an unsubsidized year at university to settle down and á

This situation keeps occurring - when my little sister disagrees á
with me or vice-versa. We have very similar temperaments and I á

When my grandmother, who has been living with us for 14 years, á

A gathering of a social sports club at which they proceeded to á
show pornographic videos and then afterwards (when most people á

Like guilt - the most ashamed I have ever felt was when I began á

only "the thing to do", and not really an act of love.

This feeling of guilt really applies to moral/religious views. I á
(being Catholic) went against what I was brought up to believe in á

My mother along with some of my friends gave me a surprise á

My mother did not come home till late at night (Ages ago). Anyway á

Because I am the Captain of a basketball team I usually organise á

So as to be closer to the university I have left home and moved á
into Auckland. It now seems as if I have left home - especially á

A friend of mine goes out with this guy. She sleeps with him but á
is quite happy for him to play around - as well as herself.
NO RESPONSE.

I did not attend a social studies observation class for 1 whole á

Passing my pharmacy exams which meant my tertiary education for á

When I was in a car with my parents and friends and we had to á

When my boyfriend wouldn't dance with me on my graduation night á

When my sister (really my niece) died of cancer at the age of 2 á

My brother gave me a beating because he could not beat me á

I found I was pregnant and unmarried.

When I had to go to reconciliation before converting to á

Joy for me is when all my family gather around home for special á

I had this experience of fear when few people were fighting at a á

Never really had the experience just yet - N/A.

This occurred when my girlfriend and I have to finish our á

I'm very disgusted when I see people abusing their body with á

NO RESPONSE.
This I experienced when going around with more than one girl.
Letting Jesus take control of my emotions i.e., ill feeling.
Had fear of losing husband.

When present boyfriend's mother approached my parents and self - á

When boyfriend could not stand up to his mother or for himself.

Disgusted with boyfriend's mother - her overpowering, á

When ditched - divorced by husband.

When I had to lie about my age to be accepted as a member of a á

My cousin asked me to be a bridesmaid for her. This made really á

That if ever I was really naughty I would be sent away from my á

(1) My father died. (2) My natural father contacted me a year á

My father died. I was away at the time and did not know until two á

A child told me she had been sexually abused by her step-father. á

When my natural parents name would show up on papers and not my, á

I lied to my mother in the sixth form she said she would ring to á

Joy at meeting a woman I love very much.
When approached by a gang of youths in town at night.

When a man, a stranger to me, personally insulted a close woman á

After my father died suddenly of a heart attack.

When a man spoke very sexistly in the company of some friends of á

When I went to explain to a lecturer whom I liked that the work á

When I masturbated in my room.

When my lover and I felt like we had gone full circle. And our á

My daughter was 2 yrs she went up to a colt tried to hit it. It á

My anger is with men, their inability to be human (not all men).

The saddest I've ever been was when my lover was killed, á

With the N.Z. Rugby Union wanting to send the All Blacks to South á

That my brother and father are into alcohol, two men with á

When I betrayed my lover, she told me something in confidence, I á

A good friend, the wife of the vicar of my church came up to me á

I walked up the main street of Auckland at 10 o'clock at night. I á

Someone in my family (my brother I suspected) ate a bun which I á

Sitting in a bus, I heard behind, the voice of a girl I was á

I decided it wasn't her in fact that someone miming her, which it á

Having moved into a flat within the last week I felt some disgust á

I criticised an action of my mother and for the first time she á

I felt that I contributed to a possible rift in the relationship á

My friend replying to my letter and again saying he was attracted á

Being sexually assaulted (not rape, but passionate kissing) by a á

I live by myself and a few weeks ago was woke by a man on the end á

him and he backed off - kept telling him - loudly, but firmly to á

When my grandmother died - I wasn't sad so much that she'd died á

When during a social evening with my father, brother, sister, á

When the girl whom I have lusted after expressed reciprocal á

When a close friend wilfully cheated me.

While intoxicated I invaded someone's (a girl's) personal space á

While intoxicated I damaged my sister's car in a minor way and á

Girlfriend arriving back from overseas and picking her up from á

Fear of punishment for having broken an item of value to my á

That a friend had been badly beaten and stabbed many times and á

The death of an animal we had reared.

Finding that a girlfriend of mine was a prostitute and had been á

Not having owned up to the responsibility an incident where á

Had started a relationship and did nothing to keep it up, partly á

The feeling of joy when again I had confessed my sin and á

Riding through a bush fire on an island of Australia - on a á

When bicycling along, a courier van started to tail me very close á

My cat was sick and I had to take him to the vet to be put down - á

When someone I had had a relationship (purely sexual) with came á

When a close friend entrusted me with a secret and I let the cat á

Making a sexual pass at my cousin with whom I have a very close á

First time I slept with my present girlfriend. Had been best á

Waiting for a taxi - when within 1/2 an hour two separate people á

Deliberately provoked by someone close. Angered by the á

My girlfriend let me down badly 3 times in one week. These á

A close friend took part in a racist violent action.
Cannot recall the emotion with any force.
Slept with someone close to my girlfriend and myself.

Hearing that I had been successful in getting a position whereby á

When I decided to leave my steady, secure employment to come to á

When a close friend failed to live up to the expectations I had á

Departure of a very close friend - for a long stay overseas, á

I get disgusted with the inherent racist attitudes of my á

My failure to provide the appropriate emotional/spiritual level á

When I deliberately engineered a situation to cause tension á

Hearing Fran Wilde introduce the Bill.

Being harrassed for being gay; suggestions of being physically á

Landlord putting up rents sneakly and slimily.

Listening and watching a tape of someone with AIDS being á

Hearing Norman Jones get hysterical in Parliament about law á

Watching Muldoon act as my P.M.

Adolescent guilt growing up feeling "bad, immoral" sexual á

Won a prize for effort.
Assaulted by drunken neighbour.

I was playing in a football tournament and saw the rules openly á

Death of brother.
Reading literature on AIDS/homosexuality.

I am ashamed at myself sometimes when I am working with á

I was late meeting someone for an appointment.

I was feeling really low - had been a series of fights with my á

I was watching a movie alone - it was a horror movie. The music á

My sister and I were fighting as usual. She's older tham I am, á

My paternal grandmother had died. We weren't close but she was á

My older sister used to pick on my brothers and sisters all of á

My first real experience with a boy. We were alone. I was quite á

I was using my sister's stereo while everyone was out. I know she á

Winning a rowing race at a Karapiro regatta. With 7 other á

Being alone in Europe and having to catch a train and bus to the á

At school teacher for not allowing us to go out on New Year's Eve á

I was in a car accident on the way back from a weekend rowing á

Our boarder burping after meals !

Felt ashamed when in a group conversation and could not á

Guilty when I hadn't walked my dog for quite a few days and had á

When I won a position on the track-team for the trans-tasman á

When I was jumped by three men in a deserted area.

Once a person in authority (school teacher) was telling blatant á

When my mother died.

When somebody who had been a bully and had acted cruelly to á

When I was twelve I was babysitting some children but I did not á

When something went wrong for me I lashed out at someone else á

Easter holiday - I had been working weekends and had just left.
Haven't been frightened for ages.

I visited a special education school. The headmaster applied a á

I felt sad with the two situations I described before. The cat á

On a trip to Santander a child sitting beside me fell ill and á

I fell down in the bus when it braked suddenly and everybody á

When I finished a test type of exam and did not dare to answer á

When I was back home after a long time, meeting beloved people á
